russel 3000 inclusion trading discussion discussion thread for potential trade ideas around the russel 3000 rebalancing so for those that don t know about this the russel 3000 index is going through a rebalancing thats going to be effective this friday eod the final list of new stocks that are going to be included is here there s a bunch of companies we can t discuss here but among the larger and more notable ones there s lcid abnb afrm coin and rklb thats going to be included i m sure you ll find your favorite memeshitstock on there too now one trade idea is to just buy some shares in what ever you like and sell them to the funds exactly eod for this to work your broker must support a moc order a marketonclose order for the closing auction of the day if you ve never entered one they are kinda different from a normal order they are market orders that can t be canceled after 350pm and designed to give you the official 4pm closing price of the day in a sort of auction in order for price discovery to work imbalance infos are public and are communicated by the exchanges at various points throughout the day etfs and funds that follow the russel 3000 would enter their buy orders throughout the day anybody else can try to buy low during the day and enter a moc sell order to match their buys and hopefully sell higher slightly more advanced would be to cross correlate this russel 3000 list with an imbalance list thoughout the day and only buy what ever has an actual imbalance of buysell orders for example on you can find this information now there s a possible problem with all of this i haven t found many etfs that track the russel 3000 there s iwv ishares russell 3000 etf 10b aum and vanguard russell 3000 etf about 110 of iwv but the aum together with the long list of stocks to be included well that alone wouldn t move the needle but there must be some other funds following it too if you know what other money is following russel 3000 please let me know

the situations at svb and frc are materially different here s why silicon valley bank was a bank for startup co s who relied on recurring venture funding rounds to keep the lights on once the the venture capital funding rounds slowed this immediately put pressure on the depositor s cash account as each passing month was another month of cash burn for the startups it banked this led to rapidly declining deposits and in turn provided management with little choice other than to sell their mbs at a loss assets that would otherwise cover interest payments on deposits if maintained on the bs frc banks a different clientele prominently wealthy individuals not startup s who don t have a cash burn and on average maintain less cash in their accounts than the maximum insurance provided by fdic frc is responsibly managed and wrongly intertwined in this conversation there isn t a bank run as the average depositor s funds are 100 insured by the fdic therefore the long term mbs investments are not only sufficient to generate positive nii but are the responsible method to generate low yet consistent interest returns on such a large number of deposits it is very rare to see an opportunity like this in the market and it is why i like the stock once the stock bounces back it will bounce back quickly as short sellers will need to purchase stock in the open market to cover their margin calls this past week was merely a run on the companies stock which lacks fundamental correlation to company performance the decline in value and outstanding short positions has increased the stocks gamma squeeze potential over the past week as its days to cover ratio has increased to over 7 once the stock begins to bounce back it will bounce back fast

fraud or not 15 august sec filing signed by ryan cohen declaring that he owns almost 78m bbby shares plus option contracts for another 17m bbby shares 16 august sec filing again signed by ryan cohen stating that he have a stake of 945m shares inclusive of his option contracts exercise power 17m bbby shares it specifically states that after reasonable inquiry and to the best of his knowledge and belief each of the undersigned certifies that the information set forth in this statement is true complete and correct according to the 2 sec filings rc owned his total bbby stake on the 16th august the above filings were submitted through the edgar sec system which makes them publicly available instantly then on the 18th august filing signed again by ryan cohen we have a statement that he has sold all his shares and options on the 16th the same date that he released the previous filing stating that he is still in possession of his bbby stake again this was filed via the edgar system making it publicly available instantly however due to his large stake in the company he could not sell without declaring his intent to do so large shareholders are simply not allowed to sell their stakes without formally declaring it so where is that filing well on the 16th august he filed an f144 form declaring his intent to sell it is worth noting that the f144 is a paper form which means it is filled in by hand and does not become publicly available until months later when it gets digitized unless of course someone specifically requests to see the fillings of the day for a particular company scans it and uploads it online there is no requirement to fill an f144 form to declare someone s intent to sell they can file an edgar form online as they have done with all their other filings to date ryan cohen chose to file via edgar every time except when it was to sell knowing that the document would take a long time to become available online more important than everything else he was filing statements that he owned his bbby stake the same day he filed his intent to sell and the same date he did sell what do you think

value in this allknowing market one must be willing to sift through the mud to find cheap companies and big lots is cheap metrics like pb at 061 and pe at 908 point fervently to negative investor sentiment but check out some of their competitors to get a relative idea retailers pb pe as you can see big lots blows away the peers in terms of relative valuation trading for the cheapest earnings and almost half the value of their assets tailwinds coming at this point i don t think anyone questions the nearterm direction of the economy stagflation will lead to tighter consumer budgets forcing people to shop at discount retailers like big lots like everyone else big lots will surely feel pressure from rising interest rates and other effects tied to economic pullback but as store traffic and sales increase this should outweigh the effects they have also been increasing inventories significantly over the past year getting out ahead of supply chain disruptions and rising shipping costs inventories have increased 42 since january of last year which they prudently funded much of through capital efficient saleleasebacks on four of their distribution centers through loading up for oncoming forecasted demand as summer cyclicality swinging in their favor q2 will likely be a move in the right direction impressive dividends not only does big lots offer positive free cash flow at a ridiculously cheap price but they also pay shareholders outsized dividends for holding their stock big lots 573 annual yield bests the competition by a long shot take a look at the below retailers dividend yield for context dividend yield for the sp 500 index was 169 in q2 2022 and has hovered around this level for years big lots marketbeating dividends make this cheap stock even more attractive to hold long term something many of the company insiders are doing through the form of stock grants big lots leadership has been loading up on shares recently over the last six months 465 446 restricted shares have been granted to insiders valued around $16m conversely only 178 498 have been sold granted these newly awarded shares have a vesting period incentivizing insider ownership short squeeze potential given the right catalyst and publicity big lots could present an interesting short squeeze opportunity the wsb veterans will know the ins and outs of a short squeeze but as a refresher some typical indicators that a company could possibly undergo one in the near future are 1 high short volume 5x average daily volume 2 high number of shares short as a percentage of float 10 of float 3 increasing shares short big lots short volume was 99mm shares as of 715 this is 745x average daily trading volume of 13mm shares check big lots shares short as a percentage of float was 374 signaling a significant portion of tradable shares is being shorted check and with 745 days to cover or short interest ratio it would take over a week for short sellers to cover their positions given a sizeable uptick in the share price however it is interesting to note that volume has been trending down in recent months this past month saw a reduction to around 975 000 average daily volume which extends days to cover to 1015 days over two full trading weeks this lengthy amount of time could prove a burdensome liquidation risk for short sellers causing them to close their positions in turn driving big lots price higher the one portion of this threepronged approach that big lots might be missing is the increasing number of shares short as the share price has declined heavily so has the short interest dropping 59 from 630 this is not a great sign for the short squeeze opportunity as it means short sellers are exiting their positions in the green and relieving sell pressure from the stock however share prices have been increasing over the past week faster than the shorts have been exiting which is a good sign for this strategy a large catalyst like q2 earnings outperformance which should be in a couple of weeks could be enough to tip the scale and set off a short squeeze valuation with conservative assumptions in a basic dividend discount model big lots looks undervalued see my ddm valuation assumptions below x200b big lots ddm valuation to come up with a conservative cost of equity i used the capital asset pricing model where the riskfree rate is equal to the current 10year treasury rate beta is a composite average from five separate sources and market rate of return is equal to the 30year inflation adjusted market return this boils down to a capm cost of equity of 107 big lots is expected to pay another $120 annual dividend per share next year and have experienced an impressive fiveyear dividend growth rate of 69 combining these figures results in a target share price of $3159 a 53 premium over 8422 closing price this does not include the effects of a potential short squeeze in my opinion it is not entirely useful to use a discounted cash flow dcf model for big lots because there are so many factors that could impact future cash flows and cost of capital assumptions are rapidly changing due to macro trends i also believe that comparable performance will be a huge key to big lots value creation in the near term and the dcf model does not consider this summary i m not going to ignore the many risks associated with big lots less than desirable financials questionable growth prospects and recent earnings miss and i would normally caution against a relatively small retail chain going up against giants during a time of economic strife but like wsb legend dfv said if none of the companies you invest in go bankrupt you aren t taking enough risk dfv the way i see it the pros outweigh the cons big lots trades extremely cheap they are free cash flow positive they pay an incredible dividend yield they have serious oncoming macro tailwinds and they are one headline away from a massive short squeeze solid fundamentals with huge optionality what s not to love

the companies going public at a rapid pace during the dot com era dial up was the primary internet most homes didn t have a computer or cell phones and robinhood didn t exist today we have fiber optic internet more information on the internet than a person can read in one lifetime you can order food to your doorstep or be the driver delivering the food get anything you want when you want it if the internet at the time was faster and the infrastructure was in place the bust may never have happened a primary driving factor of the bubble bursting was low interest rates from 199899 allowing lots of startups to open with cheap moneyborrowing we don t have that now and ai is still thriving most companies that did go public had zero earnings or value just hoping to capitalize on the boom this isn t the election could be a big tailwind for stocks heading into the end of the year on an historical basis the sweet spot of the 4year cycle is now stock market historian jeff hirsch from the stock trader s almanac said in a recent note to clients it s a wellstudied phenomenon the sp 500 has tended to underperform in the year leading up to midterm elections and outperformed in the year after midterms especially in the period immediately after the election the average annual return of the sp 500 in the 12 months before a midterm election since 1962 is 03 significantly lower than the historical average of 81 us bancorp said in a recent note that switches after the election in the 12month period after a midterm election the sp is up an average of 163 the outperformance was especially notable in the period three months and six months after the election when the sp was up 73 and 151 on average most attribute the reason for underperformance to policy uncertainty investors do not know which political party will hold a majority in congress which resolves after the midterm election the prospects of the end of the uncertainty are like the light at the end of the tunnel hirsch said in an email to me over the weekend the potential for republican control of the house of representatives and maybe the senate is sending signals that at the very least higher taxes and more spending are unlikely to the extent that 2022 turns out to be a wave election for republicans the bigger the wave the more impactful we think it will be for us equities in the short term and into next year rbc capital said in a note to clients over the weekend hirsch also noted that the postelection rally was broadbased three months after the midterm election the dow sp 500 and nasdaq were all higher on average from 64 to 92 going back to 1950 the sp was higher 889 of the time regardless strong seasonals are not enough to overcome the macro backdrop of aggressive central banks and the prospect of a worldwide economic slowdown we see no compelling reason to add risk despite the possibility of a bit more yearend upside tony dwyer from canaccord genuity said in a note to clients strong seasonals aren t enough to get morgan stanley s mike wilson to change his bearish tone either we remain fundamentally bearish with leading indicators showing further deterioration he said source

markets rally was powell dovish fed days usually provide plenty of entertainment for the markets the potential for a monetary policy change or perhaps a slip of the tongue by the fed chair has volatility traders on alert algos are tuned into the slightest change in tone or wording coming from the world s largest central bank the immediate reaction is usually a little confusing most investors sit on their hands and allow the whippy price action to play out the true understanding of how the market comprehends the direction of the fed starts 24 hours after the decision so what did we learn from the fed and which way should we lean in this market sp futures 3minute chart from 2pm4pm x200b as per usual we received the fed statement at 2pm sp futures traded at 4230 up approx 060 nasdaq futures were at 14605 up 1 the fed statement was a carbon copy of the september 20 missive with two notable changes the fed upgraded the language on the economy to state it expanded at a strong pace in the third quarter compared to expanding at a solid pace the other move was to describe the job gains as moderated compared to slowed another nod towards a strong economy that has the fed leaning toward a hike rather than a cut small tweaks but every change in fed language is done so with a purpose hawks took it as a sign that the next likely move remains a hike not a cut this led to some profittaking in equities but the roll was shortlived stocks would muddle around in a tight range as there was little in the way of new information in the statement the markets prepared for fed chair jerome powell s conference call which kicked off at 230pm the sp traded at 4233 up 3 points from 2pm and the nasdaq was 9 points higher as we can see there was little interest in the fed statement this was by design powell used his prepared remarks to hammer home the idea that inflation remained the top priority of the fed while there have been positive developments in pricing data over the past few months there is still a long way to go the rest of his prepared remarks rehashed themes that the fed has focused on the past couple of months the economy is resilient the labor market is strong financial conditions are stable etc nasdaq 100 futures 3minute chart 24pm x200b the question and answer session is always when things get a little more interesting one can see the thrill in the reporters as they fire questions at the fed chair hoping that a slip of the tongue will lead to a move in markets and provide the inquisitor their 15 minutes of fame many a fed chair has caused selling pressure in stocks with one errant answer this is where fed chairpeople earn their money one of the most soughtafter questions is whether the fed decided on what it would do in its next meeting powell continued to walk the line that the central bank remains datadependent he emphasized that the bank has not made any decisions nor did they discuss their plans for december it remains datadependent to wit there will be two jobs reports one this friday and two cpi numbers released before the fed s next meeting the markets will track these closely powell was asked directly if the bias of the fed had changed the reporter felt the fed appeared more neutral than in the one rate hike camp powell did not agree with that assessment and said it was still more likely to hike rather than cut he said the current pause is working well as it allows the fed time to see if it needs to do more on the rate hike front the fed will update its thought process in its december meeting with fresh dot plots and summary of economic projections of course later in the meeting we would walk that back a little as he suggested that the risk of doing too much was now on par with the risk of doing too little this is what led to the breakout in equities around 3pm this flipping back and forth in commentary was reminiscent of his qa at the economic club of new york we would note that expectations for the fed to hold rates at 525550 rose to 82 from 68 following the fed developments cme fed fund futures x200b when asked about the economy powell reiterated that we would need to see slower growth and weakening of the labor market before it could move off its current course he did find it remarkable that we made progress on inflation while the job market continued to strengthen powell stressed that longterm inflation expectations remain anchored and that is key he felt that wages are on the decline in a gradual way that will be supportive of returning inflation to the 2 level this is all in line with prior comments on the subject of the balance sheet and financial conditions the committee is not considering changing the balance sheet and the pace of its quantitative tightening program it looks at a wide range of financial conditions and there is nothing to suggest that there is something broken in the system that would give the fed pause powell was asked what the fed monitors to determine the health of financial conditions he did not want to go into detail but he mentioned the level of the dollar the level of equity prices the level of rates and credit spreads the mention of the level of equity prices is interesting this hardly suggests that the fed put is back but it may provide some relief to the market that the central bank is monitoring the market the fed chair reiterated his belief that the reason for rates marching higher is not because of expectations that the fed will move aggressively higher powell stated that the fed does not look at longterm treasury rates in isolation but it is aware of them they are viewed as part of the broader picture the fed chair was asked about the neutral rate which is something that has been up for debate he did not give a number but stated that the current policy was in restrictive territory naturally the fed continues to monitor the geopolitical situation the sp would close at 4260 30 points higher than where it was at 2pm the nasdaq rallied 123 points over that period obviously powell was hawkish given such a move right not so fast powell reaffirmed a lot of prior comments if we were to give a narrative to the move it is simply that powell did not say anything to disrupt the bounce that has taken place the past three sessions market participants usually take 24 hours to allow things to play out the apple aapl earnings on thursday afternoon and jobs report on friday morning stand as more significant events for the markets the fed is going meeting by meeting and asking itself at each one whether it is making progress on its goals it is that simple we will see what type of progress they are making with the jobs and cpi reports today s fed meeting was a nonevent we suggest moving on and going back to the regularly scheduled program which is a market that has bounced and now testing key downward trend lines and 20day moving averages for resistance this should be the north star traders use moving forward

mark cuban calls stock buybacks everything wrong with what companies do in response to the proposed tax on stock buybacks the entrepreneur mark cuban just took a stand in a debate that s hotly controversial in business circles and congress no subject is more controversial in economic circles right now than taxes tensions heighten even more when the specific subject is a new tax aimed at businesses simply put the business community hates taxes no surprise then that last week when the us senate agreed to a 1 tax on share buybacks as a way to partly finance president joe biden s climate and healthcare bill the proposed measure prompted a lot of debate opinion on the benefits and disadvantages of buybacks is sharply split the house is expected to vote on the bill this week enter mark cuban one of the most listenedto and admired entrepreneurs the shark tank star has never made a secret of his aversion to share buybacks he says buybacks are not good for most employees of the monetary and financial alternatives at the libertarian think tank cato institute buybacks reward holders who want to sell a littleappreciated fact is that most repurchased shares either go to well then jpmorgan chase it is to kick off the worldwide recession festivities turns out jamie dimon is the most retarded degen gambler of all anyone know his username bc the loss porn is going to be unbelievable archive link federal data show jpmorgan chase is by far the riskiest bank in the us bypam martens and russ martens july 26 2022 the longtenured chairman and ceo of jpmorgan chase jamie dimon likes to use the phrase fortress balance sheet when talking about his bank to congress or shareholders but the data stored at its federal regulators show that the bank is by far the most systemically dangerous bank in the united states and despite its high risk profile neither congress nor federal regulators have restricted its growth its assets have soared by 65 percent since the end of 2016 and stood at $395 trillion as of march 31 making it the largest bank in the united states making this situation even more dangerous the bank hasadmitted to five criminal felony counts over the past eight years and a multitude of civil crimes and multibillion dollar fines all during the tenure of dimon neither congress nor federal regulators nor the justice department that brought those felony counts has demanded that dimon be replaced the board of directors of the bank has been equally obsequious toward dimon awarding hima $50 million bonus after the bank admitted to its fourth and fifth felony counts for tens of thousands of trades that rigged the precious metals and us treasury markets our data comes from the national information center a repository of bank data collected by the federal reserve it is part of the federal financial institutions examination councilffiec which was created by federal legislation to create uniformity in the examination of us financial institutions by the various banking regulators each year the national information center creates a graphic profile of banks measured by 12 systemic risk indicators thedata used to create these graphicscome from the systemic risk report or form fr y15 that banks are required to file with the federal reserve to measure the systemic risk that a particular bank poses to the stability of the us financial system the data is broken down into five categories of system risk size interconnectedness substitutability complexity and crossjurisdictional activity those measurements consist of 12 pieces of financial information that banks have to provide on their y15 forms the most recent data is for the period ending december 31 2020 it indicates that in 8 out of 12 measurements or twothirds of all systemic risk measurements jpmorgan chase ranks at the top for having the riskiest footprint among its peer banks one of the 12 financial metrics is based on the intrafinancial system liabilities of each bank this shows how much money a particular bank has at risk at other banks by using inputs such as how much of its funds it has on deposit with or has been lent to other financial institutions the unused portion of any credit lines it has committed to other financial institutions and its holdings of debt equity commercial paper etc of other financial institutions the idea is to understand the interconnectivity of systemicallyrisky megabanks and whether one distressed megabank could cause a daisychain of contagion with other megabanks such as the contagion caused by citigroup and lehman brothers in 2008 jpmorgan chase s footprint for intrafinancial system liabilities is huge the 2020 data show that jpmorgan chase has $577 billion exposure in that category that s an increase of $182 billion over what it showed in that category in 2019 a startling increase of 46 percent in one year equally unnerving jpmorgan chase ranks number one in the instruments that played a major role in blowing up wall street in 2008 otc overthecounter derivatives these are private contracts between two parties and lack the transparency or protections of being traded on an exchange this means if the counterparty defaults and the exposure is large enough it could put a federallyinsured bank at risk this is not a hypothetical scenario the giant insurer aig blew itself up in 2008 because it was holding tens of billions of dollars in otc derivative contracts for the biggest banks on wall street on which it could not pay its obligations the us government was forced to nationalize aig and paid more than $90 billion to the banks for their aig derivative contracts and securities lending obligations according to the data jpmorgan chase has the largest exposure to otc derivatives with $4438 trillion exposure the doddfrank financial reform legislation of 2010 was hyped as ending the hubris of otc derivatives it was supposed to force these vehicles into the sunlight of exchanges and central clearinghouses but that hasn t happened corporate business media is simply declining to report on it according to the office of the comptroller of the currency the federal regulator of national banks as of march 31 2022 only 434 percent of banks derivative holdings were centrally cleared see page 13 at this link that statistic comes 12 years after doddfrank was signed into law showing just how lax federal regulators have been in enforcing the congressional intent of the law adding to the systemic dangers of jpmorgan it is a pivotal cog in the us payments system the bank was responsible for $510 trillion of the us payments system in 2020 a 51 percent increase over its size in that category in 2019 the $510 trillion is more than the next three largest banks in that category combined bank of new york mellon at $19423 trillion citigroup at $17657 trillion and bank of america at $13834 trillion and despite dimon perpetually bragging about the bank s fortress balance sheet the federal reserve has yet to explain why a unit of jpmorgan chase jp morgan securities needed to secretly borrow a cumulative $259 trillion in repo loans from the fed in the last quarter of 2019 long before the first case of covid19 appeared in the us see chart below the senate banking committee has told wall street on paradethat it will be scheduling its annual hearing with wall street ceos before the year is out the committee needs to stop using wells fargo as a convenient punching bag and focus on the dangerous elephant in the room jpmorgan chase by the way wells fargo did not rank number one in even one of the 12 systemic risk categories x200b

1423 spy es futures and tesla daily market analysis and fomc minute review today was fomc minutes lets take a look at what was reiterated remember none of this is new information all of this is things said at the december fomc meeting information below form zerohedge fed officials were not pleased by the surge in stocks easing in financial conditions ahead of the meeting warning against an unwarranted easing in financial conditions participants noted that because monetary policy worked importantly through financial markets an unwarranted easing in financial conditions especially if driven by a misperception by the public of the committee s reaction function would complicate the committee s effort to restore price stability slowing rate hikes is not pivoting participants reaffirmed their strong commitment to returning inflation to the committee s 2 percent objective a number of participants emphasized that it would be important to clearly communicate that a slowing in the pace of rate increases was not an indication of any weakening of the committee s resolve to achieve its pricestability goal or a judgment that inflation was already on a persistent downward path few signs of a wageprice spiral participants noted that in the latest inflation data the pace of increase for prices of core services excluding shelterwhich represents the largest component of core pce price inflationwas high they also remarked that this component of inflation has tended to be closely linked to nominal wage growth and therefore would likely remain persistently elevated if the labor market remained very tight consequently while there were few signs of adverse wageprice dynamics at present they assessed that bringing down this component of inflation to mandateconsistent levels would require some softening in the growth of labor demand to bring the labor market back into better balance fomc inflation forecasts core goods inflation was anticipated to slow further housing services inflation was expected to peak in 2023 and then move down while core nonhousing services inflation was forecast to move down as wage growth eased risks are skewed to the upside for inflation but downside for growth with inflation still elevated the staff continued to view the risks to the inflation projection as skewed to the upside moreover the sluggish growth in real private domestic spending expected over the next year a subdued global economic outlook and persistently tight financial conditions were seen as tilting the risks to the downside around the baseline projection for real economic activity and the staff still viewed the possibility of a recession sometime over the next year as a plausible alternative to the baseline qt staff indicated that they would continue to monitor money market conditions closely as balance sheet reduction proceeds x200b bloomberg economics anna wong summarized as follows minutes reveal that fed staff are cautious about interpreting recent data as showing a definitive decline in inflation for example they note that the falling inflation compensation implied by tips is due to a decline in risk premiums rather than inflation expectations staff point to jobopenings data moving down in october however jolts data for november released today showed an upward revision to october s job openings and the vacancytounemployed ratio actually edged back up in november staff sound more alarmed about nominal wage growth than in previous fomc minutes hinting that the underlying pace might be running at 5 so market profile analysis on tsla going into friday s session i wanted to share some of my observations on tsla from a tpo chart just some context on what a tpo chart exactly is tpo stands for time price opportunity each tpo denoted by a single letter represents a point of time where the security trades at a specific price a single tpo is printed on the chart every time that a certain price in my example for tsla each block is 10 cents is touched during any time period typically the periods are set to 30 minutes therefore every different letter that you see in the distribution denotes a different 30 minute period basically we re analyzing the amount of trading activity based on time i also utilize a similar chart but for volume instead of time now to the analysis there s a few important takeaways for me from thursday s session we created a poor high this is indicated by multiple letters at the high and a lack of a clear tail like we see for the 1011 session highs a poor high on a tpo chart indicates an abrupt halt in upward price movement often lacking excess it suggests an incomplete auction the poor high has two forward looking indications the first is that prices should back away from the poor high as there are a number of longs trapped at poor location the second is that if the next day or in some subsequent session the poor high is revisited then the odds are strong that it will break and move higher this is called repair as it repairs the structure of the poor high that lacked symmetry without a proper top we can also see that there was not much interest in trading around 26040 26090 range and a new distribution was setup lower at the close based on afternoon trading i prefer bears going into friday s session bears will look to defend 26090 and prevent the stock from trading into the original distribution target would be 255 as that is an area where we have spent a lot of time in last friday and monday s session the strategy is simply to play with the single prints as that is indicative of a lack of interest in that area and take profit near the highest point in the distribution as we expect to spend a large amount of time trading in that area tpo chart for 1010 to 1012 rth sessions

pfizer acquires seagen in a $43 billion deal a big move in the battle against cancer hey fellow regards listen up pfizer inc has just made a huge move by agreeing to pay a whopping $43 billion for biotech seagen inc and its legendary targeted cancer drugs this deal is going to be epic with pfizer shelling out $229 per share in cash as announced on monday the deal is expected to close late this year or early next year so keep your eyes peeled seagen is a badass biotech company based outside seattle known for pioneering antibodydrug conjugates that are super effective at striking tumors with toxic agents with this acquisition pfizer is looking to offset losses in sales expected as some topselling drugs lose patent protection in the next few years chief executive albert bourla is pumped about this move saying that oncology continues to be the largest growth driver in global medicine and this acquisition will enhance pfizer s position in this important space and contribute meaningfully to the achievement of pfizer s near and longterm financial goals we knew something was up last month when the wall street journal reported that the two companies were in talks and now seagen which is expected to generate $22 billion in revenue this year could potentially bring pfizer a whopping $10 billion in revenues by 2030 seagen s chief executive david epstein is also thrilled saying that the proposed combination with pfizer is the right next step for seagen to further its strategy source

pow pows plan daddy pow pow hopes that by giving a 5bp increase that it will slow down consumer demand by slightly increasing prices of consumer goods for many who have surplus income this will have little to no impact on how they live for others this may cause them to decrease the quality of product that they buy or simply to buy less for most this will negatively impact household savings in doing this daddy pow pow admits that he has no significant ability to impact supply chain issues most of the problems we are seeing with prices of consumer goods relate to supply chain issues so aside from potential decreasing supply chain demand there will be little to no impact on that front supply chain issues will still fuck us in the end daddy pow pow hopes that this increase in prices will get persons who are currently not working to go back to work these persons include retired persons teenagers college students persons collecting unemployment persons living on government stipends welfare etc if nothing else changed over the next 12 months except for what daddy pow pow did then this may likely cause more persons to work and thus increase our economic stability growth however with decreased demand if i m a vendor who ships dog food and it costs me $100 to ship the dog food regardless of if it s 20 bags or 50 bags then i would ideally want to ship in batches close to 50 bags high demand supports cost savings for the supply chain what happens though when my price per unit to ship goes up because my batch size decreases well someone has to swallow those costs which means i lose some money and i also pass some losses onto my consumers in the form of a higher price now businesses are slowing down and prices go up even more we might suggest that this could be like pseudo inflation we re just barely starting to watch this whole war shit show a 5bp rate hike with possibility of war suggests that daddy pow pow thinks the whole war shindig is a complete joke and 20221013 better tasting crayons mathematically derived options plays tickers of interest tldr gamma max cross jdst 1118 13p for $120 or less sark 1118 40p for $465 or less mo 1118 475p for $080 or less crto 1118 25p for $130 or less gnw 1118 4p for $015 or less delta neutral cross pbr 1118 14c for $080 or less rblx 1118 35p for $300 or less ccj 1118 23c for $120 or less li 1118 37c for $180 or less schw 1118 725c for $335 or less trading thesis why these crayons taste better technical analysis and indicator based trading tend to use past price performance in order to predict important price levels today this analysis is based on the current option open interest with that option open interest it calculates portfoliolevel greeksnotably delta and gamma more importantly once the portfolio level greeks are established i can now simulate the change in greeks at different price points from there i can find the price levels where portfoliolevel gamma is the highest and the portfoliolevel delta is close to 0 for some tickers the underlying price reacts strongly off of delta neutral gamma max and sometimes both it s the reaction off of these price levels in the past that is being used to drive trading signals the plays and target entry prices given are calculated using a binomial option pricing model that reflect the expected size and duration of the reaction from gamma max or delta neutral a lot of these plays are profitable by underlying moves in stock the best plays benefit from the directional move as well as the increase in iv notes something to give you a new wrinkle if the price has moved past the entry price exercise caution something changed between the time these plays were generated and market open look to sell half your position on a double and freeroll the rest to exit at your discretion i tend to risk up to 1 of my total capital on any trades i take if my conviction is lower i ll only allocate 05 or even 025 of my capital to the trade and dollar cost average in the trades were calculated before market open and so are based on information up to yesterday keep that in mind when deciding to enter well after the fact with cpi being announced before market open there s a very strong chance an options price can gap past the target entry price which means the thesis needs to be doublechecked faq because others have already asked these plays are mostly puts are you a gay bear no it so happens that the companies have had some recent runup which implies they are overextended these trades are primarily some form of meanreversion either toward or away from an important price level are you entering all these plays no there have been a dearth of plays in the wsb morning talks and so i opened up my bag of tools slightly wider to point out more plays with a probable edge to help lead apes to more gain porn go through this curated list of plays pick the ones you like based on whatever additional analysis you use and get that gain porn

were very public seller protests against the fee increase etsy ultimately went through with it and predictably all sellers remained on the platform that s because etsy has become the no1 marketplace for the kinds of goods they sell so there really wasn t a good alternative for any of their sellers sellers bit the bullet and stayed with the website competition from tiktok enter tiktok which has quickly become an extremely viable channel for typical etsy products the video format and discovery options on tiktok lend themselves perfectly to products typically sold on etsy you can stumble on a video showing something cute and homemade and immediately purchase the item through tiktok here s a quote from an etsy seller on their forums from october 29 2023 i don t have a tiktok but i know a few sellers in my category that do and are killing it with sales i agree we need something live here on etsy to compete the video and live formats on tiktok are simply much more appealing to modern customers compared to etsy which essentially works the same way as amazon popular etsy products are increasing in popularity on tiktok while etsy doesn t disclose their sales by product category we can make an educated guess by visiting their best selling items website as well as other websites that make estimates without being able to quantify them these are some of the best selling product categories on etsy jewelry beads pendants etc pins stickers books tshirts tiktok has offered these creators amazing terms by taking only a 2 commission on each sale compared to 65 at etsy and paying for discounts on the products the screenshots show how search interest on tiktok has developed for some popular hashtags related to these product categories in the usa all screenshots show global search interest over the past 3 years another sign of tiktok s increasing popularity in this space is that they will be increasing their own fees on sales soon to 6 per sale by april 1 and 8 by july 1 which would be even higher than etsy s fees tiktok s parent company bytedance is highly profitable so it stands to reason that this move is not made out of desperation but because they feel like they have taken a large amount of market share in this space the total market for these sorts of custom goods is quite limited and in my opinion not growing that quickly overall my assumption is that any sale made on tiktok for these goods is a sale that etsy is losing and this seems to be supported by data etsy metrics are declining while etsy continued to be a popular holiday destination for shoppers their iphone download rank has plummeted in the new year compared to q1 of 2023 website hits for etsycom decreased by 57 yoy in the past 3 months as per similarweb unfortunately i cannot show the data since i wrote down last years website views by hand and similarweb only shows the past 3 months to free users risks a well known activist investor recently took a large stake in etsy there s a risk that they could announce shareholder friendly steps during the earnings call such as stock buybacks divestitures etc since the stake was only announced at the beginning of february 2024 i think the likelihood of concrete actions being announced is however low my position strike 70 puts expiring this week as always you can go closer to the current stock price to minimize your risk iv on etsy is not particular high with a 51 implied move in either direction

dd uranium sector come glow with me hello wsb as promised from this evening s uranium cage match here is my uranium sector dd in this discussion i will be exploring the uranium sector as a whole where things currently stand what uranium is what it s used for why uranium has a good setup for the future and how you can get into uranium should you choose to i ve been looking into this sector for over a year now and have done more hours of research than i could count before i get into anything i want to emphasize this is a long term play this is not about buying weekly calls this is not a squeeze this is an investment in a growing sector that should provide significant returns in the next few years but these returns could be massive and it is by far my highest conviction play uranium is the one trade i will comfortable say isn t a question of if i m going to make money it s when i m going to make money and if you know me you ll know i don t make such bold statements alright let s begin uranium what is it and why should i care many of you have probably heard of uranium it s that green glowing rock that kills you if you go near it and makes a godzilla right nope first it s brown not green second it s actually not very radioactive out of the ground it needs a bunch of stuff done to it before it becomes that glowing stick thing you see on the simpsons for those interested here s a how it s made episode showing uranium from mining to being turned into nuclear fuel rods but how it s made isn t as important as its use a fuel source uranium is used to power nuclear powerplants plain and simple that s its use and before you go pfft nuclear is dead waste of time understand nuclear is actually more important than you realize as of today the usa gets 18 of it s electrical generation from nuclear yes 18 that s not a small amount at all and globally nuclear accounts for 10 of global electrical generation so the idea that nuclear is dead isn t correct it s too important right now to be dead unless you think the world is going to just go into full blackouts nuclear globally isn t being shut down in the next decade no matter how badly some nations want to you need only look at germany to see the results of that they went all out shutting down reactors starting in 2011 it s now 2022 and they just finished turning off the final reactor 11 years for them to replace their nuclear and they re having energy issues from it so don t tell me the usa is going to shut down it s nuclear and replace it with wind and solar in a few years it s just too complicated for the usa to replace 18 of its entire electrical generation no matter how much wind and solar is built i actually like wind and solar mind you on top of being a major energy source nuclear is carbon neutral nuclear and wind have the lowest carbon generation per kwh 70 times less than coal not only is it low carbon it s highly energy efficient one uranium fuel pellet will generate as much energy as one ton of coal 149 gallons of oil or 1700 cubic feet of natural gas what this means you can store a ton of energy in a small space using nuclear for the usa that might not matter but for nations like japan that don t have as much space being able to store years of energy in just a few warehouses is significant past the efficiency nuclear is a baseload energy source unlike wind and solar this means it generates consistent amounts of reliable electricity 247 wind and solar can t do this sometimes it s not as windy sometimes it s not as sunny this matters because if you re building an electrical grid you need a certain amount of it to be providing a consistent predictable amount of energy otherwise you risk blackouts at certain periods electrical grids need baseload energy in order to ensure the lights stay on add in you can control how much electricity nuclear generates maybe it s really sunny you can have the nuclear powerplant spin down and produce less and rely more on solar that day when it s cloudy you can then go back to using the nuclear reactors at higher capacity and unlike wind and solar you can build a powerplant anywhere wind has to be somewhere with consistently high wind solar somewhere that has consistently high solar activity nuclear can be put wherever there s space downsides of nuclear while nuclear has many upsides there are of course downsides let s start with the giant radioactive elephant in the room nuclear meltdowns omg so scary right they happen and then millions of people die and stuff except that s not exactly true people are familiar with 3 major meltdowns chernobyl fukushima and 3 mile island let s do the easy one first 3 mile island had a grand total of 0 deaths or injuries i ll say that again 0 people were injured or died from 3 mile island nobody not just that but they got the leak under control quickly but that isn t a fun news story like powerplant leaking radiation you ll die if you don t tune in now so it s not the story that was told now onto chernobyl yes people died and the nearby land was ruined however this was a very special case see the ussr really didn t give a damn about the people of ukraine hey history is repeating when they build chernobyl like at all they wanted energy generation and skipped pretty much all safety regulations yes it was bad but nobody will ever be allowed to build a powerplant that unsafe and unregulated ever again because of it this was less nuclear bad and more neglecting any form of safety measures for any powerplant bad finally we have fukushima yes a big scary disaster but like 3 mile island nobody died from the meltdown now people died from the tsunami but there were no recorded deaths from radiation exposure there are some projected deaths from exposure that could cause cancer later but that s entirely theoretical in reality that meltdown despite again the news telling you it was the worst thing ever has directly killed 0 people to this day add in it took a historically large earthquake and the powerplant regulators ignoring a key safety measure moving the generators off the bottom floor which they had been told to do for years i don t want to downplay these events but they re not the world ending disasters the news likes to pretend they were in fact nuclear has the one of the lowest death per kwh of any energy source but again it doesn t make a good news story so why would you ever hear about that add in new nuclear powerplants being much safer and having many fail safes fun fact fukushima was actually older than chernobyl take the zaporizhzhia nuclear powerplant in ukraine russia recently bombed this powerplant during an assault everyone was freaking out know what happened nothing why because nuclear powerplant reactors are build with a protective core designed to take a direct impact from a fully fueled 767 and yes they have actually conducted this exact experiment so it s not just in theory they re a lot safer than people realize next downside the cost nuclear powerplants are expensive to build and a lot of companies don t want to build them it takes 10 years of operating for a powerplant to just break even that s a scary investment and a lot of companies won t do it but there are new powerplants being built the us recently has 2 new powerplants finish in georgia and is working on extending the lifetime of current powerplants including diablo canyon the last powerplant in california which the governor has requested a 20 year life extension for and it looks like he s going to get it that s right even super green california is now changing their tune about nuclear but it s not just the usa germany has started talking about delaying the shutdown of their remaining powerplants they probably won t but the fact germany is even willing to discuss the idea shows a huge sentiment shift japan s new ruling party has made restarting their nuclear fleet shut down since fukushima a top priority with plans for several reactors to come back online by summer 2023 india south korea romania france all have plans for new reactors even bill gates is working in wyoming on creating new safer small modular reactors smrs then there s china china has committed to building 150 new reactors over the next decade yes 150 reactors or 15 reactors a year simply put nuclear isn t going away and even seems to be growing now even gretta thunberg has come out in favor of nuclear but what about all that nuclear fuel surely the spent fuel rods are a problem right i mean everyone says we can t store them and they ll melt your face except there s not nearly as much of it as you think all the nuclear fuel generated in the usa one of the largest users of nuclear on the planet would fit inside of a single football field and only be 10 feet deep yep just one football field to store all the spent nuclear fuel ever generated by the usa since they started having power plants in the 1950 s the reality is every dangerous thing you ve heard about nuclear is the result of a very carefully planned ad campaign put out by oil and gas companies who were terrified nuclear would replace them and set out to fund multiple anti nuclear movements i want to be clear i am by no means saying nuclear is perfect but there has been a lot of money spent to convince you it s a lot more dangerous than it is and if i wanted to i could make major cases against any energy source and the dangers it possesses heck you drive in cars that are literally filled with explosive gasoline that your engine constantly blows up in tiny controlled explosions that could 100 kill you if they got out of control we just don t describe cars like that because it s a silly dramatization of the reality but that s exactly how nuclear is presented ok so nuclear will exist who cares so we ve established two things nuclear currently exists at a level too large to shut down anytime soon and places aren t just not shutting it down they re adding even more now we get to the money part see that uranium used to power a nuclear powerplant it has a problem it s too cheap how cheap today uranium sells for $52pound but it costs a mining company $65$70 pound to mine it yes companies currently lose $14$18pound mining uranium but why would they mine it if they re losing money is probably your question well for most companies they re not they have shut down all mining and are waiting for prices to go higher this has created a major deficit in supply currently 190 million pounds of uranium are used per year globally while only 140 million pounds are mined that s a 25 yearly supply deficit that has been going on for 3 years now now you might ask how is that possible to understand this you need to understand first how long it takes to convert uranium into a fuel rod this process takes between 1824 months to complete for this reason reactors have to keep a large amount of nuclear fuel in different forms on hand on average they ll have about 2 years worth of fuel on site some ready to user right away some a few months away from being usable some needing nearly the full 2 year cycle this secures them supply should something go wrong with their expected delivery well remember 2011 when fukushima hit japan shut down all their nuclear powerplants with no restart date powerplants that were now sitting on 2 years or more of fuel they were never going to use guess what they did with that fuel they sold it and this created a brand new uranium market not only was the market flooded with cheap uranium but traders could now buy uranium to resell to utilities at much lower prices than a mine could they didn t have all the capex of running a mine and staffing it they just needed to pay for storage until they could deliver it to a utility this destroyed the price of uranium just look at the chart below showing uranium price starting in 2011 x200b see that giant price drop from $50 down to a low of under $20 that s all that japanese supply flooding the market but that was over a decade ago that supply is running out not only is it starting to run out japan is restarting their reactors as stated above meaning they re going from a net seller to a buyer of uranium all that cheap supply utilities could buy up is disappearing and all the traders are running out of supply to resell and this isn t just in theory check out this video it is an interview with the man who manages nuclear fuel buying for several utilities in it he says starting this year he is havng more trouble than he s had in a long time finding supply orders he used to get done in months now would take him near a year and when the uranium supply starts to run low the price moves up and moves fast let s see another graph from 2007 x200b see that giant price spike that s from supply going away specifically from the usa ending their program of decommissioning nuclear weapons which gave a cheap supply of uranium for powerplants to buy that same thing is about to happen in the uranium sector all the cheap japanese uranium has been bought and they re done selling the traders are having a harder and harder time finding new supply to resell this is going to cause another price spike and the mining companies are going to thrive see as stated earlier most of these companies are not mining what this means is they re sitting waiting for the price to get to a level worth mining and then they ll start selling now in the uranium sector selling is done through a contract with utilities usually these contracts are signed for 10 years with a price range a bottom price so the mines don t get screwed and a top price so utilities don t get screwed as of today most companies don t have any contracts but as the supply runs out utilities are going to be forced to talk to the miners and sign these long term contracts and this isn t just theoretical cameco ccj the 2nd largest uranium mining company in the world announced in january they had signed 40 million usd in new contracting that month which was more than they did for the entire year of 2021 previously closed down us mines from are being restarted this year with plans to deliver into recently signed contracts starting in summer of 2023 and as these contracts come it s going to ramp up because the uranium sector has one other key thing it s small tiny how small the entire uranium sector has a market cap less than that of hersheys yes the chocolate company has a larger market cap than all the uranium mining companies combined not only is the sector tiny you can count on two hands all the companies currently able to mine uranium and as for the ones trying to build a mine the fastest ones expect to be running in 2024 at best here s another chart for you x200b this chart shows the total projected uranium mining compared to the demand out to 2040 see that red space above that s a deficit where demand beats out supply here s the thing about this chart it assumes a full restart of all existing mines and all planned uranium mines yes even if every single mine and planned mine came online on time with full production there would still be a huge deficit and uranium mines do not have near a 100 start rate more like a 10 chance for a company to go from discovering uranium to actually getting a functioning mine and understand something about uranium it is an inelastic fuel you can t substitute anything for uranium either you have it or you can t run your power plant and not running isn t an option as it costs $12 million per day to shut down a reactor utilities can and will pay huge amounts to get their fuel supply this is because uranium is a fraction of the cost of a powerplant it accounts for just 5 of their operational costs that s it so a powerplant can have the price of uranium shoot up and see minimal impact the analogy i like to use think of a steak dinner the steak is what s expensive now do you put salt on the steak sure but do you care what the salt costs if tomorrow salt did a 10x on price would you stop eating steak no because salt is dirt cheap so who cares what it costs the same holds for uranium and even if the price goes through the roof governments will subsidize before they allow blackouts because that s what the entire uranium sector really boils down to uranium sells for too little to the point where one of two things must happen either the price of uranium will go up to at least $65$70pound to get mines back online or when you flick a light switch in the usa in 5 years the lights will not work that s the bet you re making which one do you think is more likely to happen sprott and uranium i m going to take a quick second to talk about one other factor in the uranium sector sprott for those of you unfamiliar sprott is a resource investment fund run by a man named eric sprott he runs large physical funds that let investors buy shares which he then uses to buy physical gold or silver very simple system you buy some shares he buys some gold you can sell your shares or ask for payment of gold in an amount equal to your shares well he s doing this exact same thing for uranium minus the delivery part sorry guys you can t get uranium sent to your home the system is the same you buy shares his company uses that money to buy physical uranium which they store in a warehouse but here s the thing this is not a resell system sprott gets paid per transaction they buy an amount and keep 1 of the purchasing fee for themselves that s how they make money they do not resell this uranium in fact there currently is no system to resell the uranium in place what this means there is a system in place currently taking in millions of pounds of uranium off the market that will not resell this takes a deficit and adds even more pressure since now sprott is buying up supply from utilities additionally this added something the uranium market desperately needed price discovery for the longest time the spot market was kept at very low prices as uranium was seldom traded but sprott brought a consistent uranium buyer to the market when they came in uranium was trading at $30pound through their bids the price now sits at $50pound they helped create a consistent bidder keeping the spot price at realistic levels that reflect the true market not depressed levels traders used to better negotiate short term deals so what do i do ah the big question what do you do with this information well you find uranium miners you like and buy shares or leaps at least 1 year out though ideally 2 why because this is a very simple play the price of uranium must go up or the lights will go out and there s no way the world is choosing the lights going out so the question is not if the price of uranium will go up to at least match the inventive price and get mines back online rather the question is when will the price go up so you play the miners and wait because at some point we performance in seven years the index continued its surge as investors reflected on the rising global risks and the extremely hawkish federal reserve decision it jumped to a high of $113 which was the highest point in more than two decades this means that it has risen by more than 20 in the past 12 months since about 40 of sp 500 companies sales are generated abroad equity strategists expect the strong us dollar will weigh heavily on corporate earnings as the thirdquarter corporate reporting season begins in earnest this week analysts presently expect sp 500 index members to see earnings growth of 24 this quarter according to factset wall street forecasts tend to be conservative and companies tend to overshoot like they did last quarter but if earnings end up being in line with the consensus it would mark the worst quarterly earnings performance since the third quarter of 2020 according to john butters senior earnings analyst at factset and the strong dollar would be among the factors most to blame the companies listed above include constituents of the sp 500 consumer staples sector the healthcare sector materials and the information technology sector with semiconductor makers or suppliers in the case of applied materials representing a majority of the names on the list above looking at the dollar s impact on a sectorbysector basis cfra chief investment strategist container newbuilds in 20242025 despite the increased supply the disruptions listed below have fully absorbed the impact and along with timeline slippage additional ecofriendly regulations reducing speedsupply and expected scrapping i expect rates to be significantly less impacted by these compared to the macro geopolitical disruptions currently at stake ex lunar new year container seaonality usually causes a massive rate decrease at this time of year but rates have remained bullish and elevated throughout why now at this point given today s price action the stock has already baked in significant expectations of negative effects from a ceasefire i believe these are overblown and expand on why in the following section case for extended disruptions and elevated rates zim along with the rest of the shipping stocks fell dramatically during a false announcement deleted tweet from qatar of an israelhamas ceasefire in early february and has maintained muted pricing ever since the current investor rhetoric appears risk averse from fears of a similar drop in the case of a true ceasefire announcement as a result zim is priced in with a sentiment shift towards beliefs in a shortlived conflict and bearish rate perspectives i have several reasons why i believe this to not be the case 1 in the earlystages the russiaukraine war also had similar political and media rhetoric around ceasefires and peace agreements which has recently extended past two years of prolonged conflict 2 netanyahu has been extremely adamant about terms in the current discussions with hamas and given the publicly touted agendas of both groups a shortlived temporary ceasefire appears to be the most likely outcome if they come to agreement i am skeptical vessels would reroute through the red sea knowing ceasefire is limited to a 46 week period see 5 3 the houthis are an independent group unassociated with hamas backed by iran who s mission statement includes disrupting western institutions while the public statements claim to justify the attacks as support for gaza given the effectiveness of their attacks it appears extremely likely they d continue operations even in the case of an israelpalestine ceasefire the recent global economic effects have shown how much leverage they have and it seems disadvantageous for them to give this up this is the biggest reason why i believe ceasefire risk is overstated in the context of red sea shipping lanes 4 israel is increasingly likely to be engaged with hezbollah an additional war front with hezbollah will dramatically escalate the regional conflict and extend the duration of conflict read 612months likewise this will further any moral justifications the houthi s need for continued disruptions in the red sea my current rationale is that if this does happen then nothing will stop zim from generating 2x market cap in earnings over the next year at 10 odds of initiated hezbollah conflict this is an extremely attractive asymmetric bet 5 a significant operational cost of shipping comes from vessel insurance which has spiked dramatically or is even unavailable for red sea crossings the recently sunkdamaged ships and commentary on the ineffectiveness of defensive escorts have proved that houthi interventions are serious and effective this gives additional credence to point 3 and fiscally encourages taking longer routes 6 shipping liners as an industry have cartellike incentives when it comes to supply and demand this largely comes into play in the forward looking process of ordering container newbuilds scrapping aged portions of the fleet and balancing the expected changes in supply and demand this is a super inelastic market with small imbalances resulting in massive 210x rate shifts now they have an additional group incentive to keep the status quo of routing around the cape as it artificially reduces ton mile supply and increases the entire industry s margins while morally justifying cartel behavior in the name of crew safety 7 the panama canal is a major shipping route which has experienced massive capacity reductions due to droughts and falling elevation levels many ships are experiencing dramatically extended wait times causing a supply shock to the industry and providing another spot rate catalyst rainfall and elevation predictions imply that this will likely continue to cause slowdowns for the foreseeable future rain forecasts are always a bit noisy 8 there are risksensitivity and esgsociomoralpolitical apprehensions for why many investors and large passive flows avoid the shipping industry this in itself improves the chances of individual investors obtaining financial alpha by increasing one s risk and exposure tolerance personally i justify the moral concerns by donating portions of my capital to but this is wsb do whatever you feel comfortable with disclosure this is not financial advice please due your own due diligence i am not an advisor more of europe s crude supply is coming from deep in the heart of texas houston april 29 reuters us crude exports to europe climbed in march and april as buyers across the atlantic snapped up the country s light sweet grades to offset the expected loss of russian oil according to shipping data traders and analysts as the european union weighs an oil embargo on russia over its invasion of ukraine us exporters are ramping up shipments of us light crude to europe helped by washington s decision to release 180 million barrels of oil from the us strategic petroleum reserve which is flooding the domestic market us crude exports bound for europe are close to 15 million barrels per day bpd so far in april the highest in two years and one of the strongest months on record said matt smith lead oil analyst for the americas at data provider kpler most cargoes are carrying light sweet grades he added headed to european destinations including spain the united kingdom denmark and italy as flows have increased to europe flows bound for asia latin america and canada have dipped this month smith said price spreads making some us light grades relatively cheaper have also pushed opportunistic purchases by european refiners another source said british refineries which plan to phase out russian oil imports by the end of the year last month bought the largest volume of us crude in twoandahalf years eikon data showed most cargoes were us light sweet oil with at least a quarter delivering midland crude according to the us customs data spain is set to import a record 7 million barrels of us crude in april according to cargo tracking data after a peak in march of nearly 6 million barrels discharged for refiners including repsol repmc cepsa cpfgq and bp bpl bp did not reply to a request for comment cepsa and repsol declined to comment on individual cargoes or trade flows

understanding and respect for the more i progress in my trading practice that is how i first came to take an interest in the message of the tape of course there is always a reason for fluctuations but the tape does not concern itself with the why and wherefore it doesn t go into explanations i didn t ask the tape why when i was fourteen and i don t ask it today at forty the reason for what a certain stock does today may not be known for two or three days or weeks or months but what the dickens does that matter your business with the tape is now not tomorrow the reason can wait but you must act instantly or be left you ll remember that hollow tube went down three points the other day while the rest of the market rallied sharply that was the fact on the following monday you saw that the directors passed the dividend that was the reason they knew what they were going to do and even if they didn t sell the stock themselves they at least didn t buy it there was no inside buying no reason why it should not break reminiscences of a stock operator edwin lefevre early in my career i completely dismissed technical analysis technical analysis sounds too good to be true actually you can predict the future by drawing lines on a chart what that s it no calculus no reading balance sheets and income statements all you need is a freaking crayon and a piece of paper well yes and no alley shop from what i can tell refusal to accept ta as a legitimate technique is because laymen believe it is a prediction tool when it could be more accurately described as a probability tool that said i wanted to share what i suspect to be a true life example of the tape telegraphing something on september 28th helene meisler tweeted that defense stocks were up while the broader markets were down and asked what do they know she then speculated in a later tweet she thinks people are betting that congress was going to authorize additional funding i dismissed this as an anomaly x200b then october 7th happened the market rallied but defense stocks rallied even harder x200b xar defense etf spy sp 500 etf looking in retrospect there were anomalies everywhere the volume in xar and spy were wildly different xar rallied 3 days from 925 to 927 when spy fell xar showed significantly greater volume growth on 109 than spy did from 929 105 candlesticks shrank much more significantly for xar than for spy xar showed a bull flag formation from 106 to 1026 that confirmed on 1031 during all the moves from 925 through 1113 xar tended to fall less than the broader market and rally harder from 1018 to 1027 candlesticks on xar tended to shrink and the candlesticks for spy tended to grow larger you can literally see in the charts starting on 925 that xar had far more relative strength than
