$bbby options activity explosion stacking kegs of gunpowder tldr $bbby option interest has shown huge activity today at more than 3x volume if there is heavy upward intraweek movement there will likely be an additional upward price explosion i m not a financial advisor none of this is financial advice x200b the huge intraday activity on $bbby has created an extremely dangerous environment for market makers in the options market today s options volume is over 3x the average and sitting at over 400k as of writing this post x200b source market chameleon while the stock price has remained relatively neutral after its intraday pop call option volume is outpacing put option volume at an over 21 ratio and there is especially large volume stacking at the 12 and 14 dollar strike prices x200b aug12 options chain sourced from thinkorswim aug19 options chain sourced from thinkorswim for those of you who are new to this most of the options that are sold intraday are sourced from marketmakers who have a responsibility to provide options at reasonable spread prices this ensures that the option contracts you hold have decent liquidity and allows a market for heavily otm and itm options market makers are agnostic to price movements they normally make money off the spread on options and offset risk using complex calculations that i m not qualified to speak on normally they have their shit very covered however mm s still have an obligation to sell options at decent bidask spreads in order to maintain their mm status which gives them a lot of nice juicy trading advantages which i m also not qualified to talk about essentially you have an algorithmic trading machine which calculates volatility against a stock along with probabilistic price within a time frame sets a price for an option and then sells it while hedging significantly all of these complex models built by rocket scientists normally work very well in ensuring liquidity when things are moving rationally when encountered with sheer stupidity they fail implied volatility on a series of options is low for a while and then all of a sudden a gorilla appears and tears the shit out of everything x200b normally options are priced around expected events and even macro climates but it s difficult to price in a group of people waking up one morning and deciding to pump a pos stock especially while maintaining a low spread and decent volume this could happen to anything certain conditions like short floats help add fuel to the fire but at the end of the day excessive options contracts are the nuclear bomb i probably shouldn t do this but knowing my audience i m going to explain what an options contract specifically a call is a single options contract specifically in this instance a call allows the owner to buy 100 shares of the underlying stock at the listed stock price since it has the highest intraday volume let s look at the august 12 14 strike calls these options give you the right to buy $bbby at at 14$ a share right now these are essentially almost worthless the stock is trading a little above 11 so you wouldn t want to exercise them in the event that bbby hits 15 they d be worth around 1$ and maybe more if adjusting for volatility and time decay that s awesome but i doubt many of you have the money to exercise options most of the time they get sold back to market makers or other buyers who will pay a you a premium for being soooooooo smart and guessing that the price was higher over expiry however these contracts still represent an obligation to deliver shares of $bbby you might exercise them you might not it doesn t matter what matters is that market makers need enough cash by expiry to pay either the difference between the outstanding stock price and the option or to buy the shares the option represents so they can be delivered to you normally market makers will have a model tell them how much cash they need floating to clear their obligations for a week and roughly how much physical stock they ll need to deliver it s complicated but essentially mm s don t need to cover their exposure 1 to 1 by let s say holding 100 $bbby shares for every contract they sell that is to say normally they don t need to cover 11 mm s can try to cover the volatility of an underlying security by raising the price but if the price action on the security is especially insane there s a point where covering with cash becomes a big liability this is gonna be a bit long bear with me let s have a though experiment on the 14$ strike price options current volume on them is over 29 000 as of writing this as of this morning open interest on them was 0 open interest represents the total number of outstanding options at a specific strike so noone owned any aug 14 calls as of this morning open interest is updated daily so we ll only be able to see fresh open interest at this particular strike tomorrow morning volume is not the greatest indicator it only represents the number of times a specific option at a specific price has changed hands 29k volume basically tells you an option has traded 29 000 times it s not really possible to infer open interest from volume but it does give a very clear indication that there are a lot of transactions where there didn t used to be any for example there could be a volume of 10 000 where the open interest netted at 0 because mm s could issue 5 000 options at a strike and then buy them back same day this isn t generally the case though and this options activity implies there will be significant open interest as of tomorrow morning with that out of the way let s make up a conservative open interest of 5 000 for 14$ strike calls this would imply that there are 5 000 outstanding contracts for mm s to deliver $bbby amounting to an obligation for 500 000 shares representing 07 of the float here s a table outlining rough obligations based off that outstanding interest if the underlying options are sold outright x200b closing pricetotal obligation 14 and below0$ 15500 000$ 203 000 000$ 255 500 000$ 308 000 000$ x200b this is barely a scratch it won t move markets and it won t make the mm s blink still this is an obligation to deliver shares let s look at possible open interest on this strike the contractual delivery obligation and its representation as of float fyi outstanding float is 6844million x200b open interesttotal obligated sharespercentage of float 5 000500 0000730 10 0001 000 0001461 15 0001 500 000219 20 0002 000 000292 x200b normally mm s wouldn t give a shit about the option s contracts actual obligations since there s normally never any individual consumer incentive to exercise average options exercise rate normally hovers at 7 this implies holding just around 50 000 shares with an open interest of 5 000 since this is something that s modeled it s also open to large amounts of exploitation by hedge funds extremely wealthy traders and the like especially during periods of insanity when retards are hitting the fucking gas and pumping the price let s say you re masayoshi son and you have a billion lying around to just fuck around with the mm s with you don t give a shit about price movement or any of that and you ve bought 25k of $bbby options 14 it represents a little over 35 of the float you re out 35 million for a company trading at 11 why would you do that you retard well the mm s don t have 25million shares they expected 7 assignment and all of a sudden they re running to grab shares in a hot market to fill your options well look at that the share price isn t 11 anymore this doesn t really matter to you personally you have a shit ton of these options at different prices you don t even need to exercise them all you can hold bby as a nice pretty reminder because you ve just changed the perspective of the mm s as an mm all of a sudden that 7 exercise number is worth dogshit you ve just gotten railed by an otm exercise and you need a lot more equity to cover this open interest with these monkeys out there now it looks like you re buying does our masayoshi unwind his position now that he s in the money fuck no the rapid move on bbby caused issuance of extremely otm options in expectation for the heavy move upward you ve been sitting on aug 19 $bbby 20 or some shit you won t even exercise it you ll just sell it to the mmm s and they ll say thank you masayoshi son for not forcing us to buy more $bbby this is an example of exposure that market makers face especially when there s insane volume like this there s no guarantee a billionaire will fall out of the sky to save your dumb otm calls the purpose of the example is to illustrate that if large or retail investors change the exercise rate for options under $bbby it ll force mm s to cover to a larger extent and make issuing options which they still have an obligation to do more difficult for them this will start pegging options issuance even otm option issuance more closely to actual stock prices and push $bbby even further up and this risk is further magnified the more insane the runup is for two reasons 1 if bby is running hot going into next week there s an incentive for option holders to take shares instead of cash in an effort to keep profiting 2 market makers will be forced to take up a significant share of the float to limit their exposure to this insanity in summary 1 $bbby is extremely exposed to upward manipulation from larger investors 2 mm s are extremely exposed 3 upward price action is currently only being driven by stock sales but if exercise rates of options increase over time option sales will also start significantly impacting stock price due mm s buying shares to cover option issuance 4 major breakouts above high open interest points ie 1214 strike will magnify this effect x200b risks 1 all of this is happening because y all are in a buying frenzy there s no guarantee you ll make money off $bbby and everyone could wake up tomorrow and dump 2 larger investors could also wake up and dump just to fuck retail 3 mm s could have countermeasures to limit their obligations to physically hold shares 4 i m retarded edit something i forgot to mention is that the way that an mm will hedge an options position is by immediately selling it for a profit on the spread so an mm could be holding options sell them on the ask and then buy them on the bid if their supply of options on either side dwindles they need to start writing them which happens when there s a discrepancy in demand vs supply this creates exposure and widens the spread it is very likely that a large portion of open interest could be other retail traders like you and me or just large funds playing the other side whoever they are similar rules apply poor man s covered call what it is why i m doing it with $30k worth of msft calls and why you should consider trying it tldr at top tldr selling covered calls good you can use longterm call options as collateral instead of having to buy 100 shares of the underlying asset this makes you big money at a relatively lower risk than you might expect it s a strategy that consists of buying itm or very close to itm longterm call options and then using that as collateral to sell a short term otm covered call i made this post in response to a lot of the people on my last wsb post turns out not many people seem to know what the pmcc is despite this being a heavily option based sub reddit so i will try to simplify it for those that don t know much about options a call option gives you the option to purchase an equity at the strike price where as a person who owns 100 shares can sell a covered call option and they will sell you those 100 shares for your strike price the premium you pay is what he gets to keep so his goal is to write options that will never be able to be exercised that way he keeps both the premium and his 100 shares he does this by selling short term very otm call options they re great because there are fools that think that buying multiple cheap call options will make them more money than one really expensive in the money longterm option and this is where wsb comes in there are plenty of people in the sub that simply love fds for whatever reason i genuinely believe that some people don t fully understand why people love to sell these to them so let me explain why one is smart and why one is dumb let s say microsoft is currently $400 i bought 100 shares for that price and i m going to sell a covered call that expires in one month at a strike price of 425 let s say that microsoft hit the price of $430 and the person exercised the option in this scenario i would have to sell my 100 shares of microsoft for $425 despite selling for $430 on the market but hey remember you bought them for $400 now you sold them for $425 and you get to keep whatever the person paid for the premium on top of that the risk here is that microsoft could hit something like $470 and you would still have to sell it for $425 and the premium you made is nowhere near enough to compensate the money you could ve gotten if you would ve just held onto it and not sold you as the call option writer can decide to sell a very short term very out the money call option that will likely never be exercised but it will be sold for cheap or you could sell a very close to the money longerterm call option for a massive premium or of course something in between but with that being said 80 of all call options written expire worthless so you do have a bit of a competitive edge on your side now as for the buyer he buys a bunch of short term out the money call options for cheap because he thinks he will make more money this way which is of course possible but it would be very very unlikely unfortunately theta really kicks in the last 12 months so because he chose a short term option he really really needs to fight against the clock here also because the call options he bought are really otm the delta on his options are very low meaning he would need a massive price movement in order to feel anything through his options obviously he is set up for failure and his call options expire worthless which happens 90 of the time and even when it doesn t it doesn t necessarily make up for all the money lost in the past so what have we learned selling covered calls good buying short term out the money options bad but do you have $40 000 to buy 100 shares of microsoft so that you can write call options on it or let s assume that you do you could buy 100 shares or you can buy multiple longterm call options that are itm or close to it and remember each call option represents 100 shares of microsoft and because let s say you bought three you can then sell three short term out the money covered call options if you get assigned you now have to sell 100 shares to the person at whatever the strike is you don t need to actually own 100 shares you just need to have enough money to buy 100 shares and then you will sell them at the strike price but wait the stock price must have gone up in order for the options to able to be exercised but wait you own call options see where this is going most uptodate brokerages let you use call options as collateral to sell covered calls because of this very reason in the scenario where you get assigned you should hopefully have call options that increased in value now you can sell a call option for more than what you bought it for and on top of that you keep the premium however this introduces more risk because depending on your contract length and how near the money your call options that you bought and sold are it is completely possible to have to pay a lot for the assignment and not have options that went up all that much and they can always expire worthless if you do decide to keep holding them also if you think the covered call you sold will be dramatically itm by its expiration date at some point you could just pay to close the position you ll pay whatever premium it s going for but then you won t be using it as collateral any longer much better than being assigned but there are ways to minimize this simply put sell short term out the money options so that whoever buys them has to deal with high theta and low delta meaning time decay will dramatically eat up the intrinsic value of the contract and there would have to be massive price movement to have a positive effect on the option price they bought meanwhile you buy longterm in the money call options as collateral meaning that theta will not eat up much of its intrinsic value and because your delta is very high since it s in the money small movements in the underlying assets will have a bigger impact on your option whether for better or for worse oh and now you re able to sell many more call options because instead of buying 100 shares you bought contracts that represent 100 shares of course like anything it works until it doesn t but even if the underlying asset you write it on end up tanking you at least keep the premium depending on how long the contract is you could hold if you think it might eventually go back up or sell it for significantly less than what you bought it for but at the very least it keeps a lot of its intrinsic value since it s a longterm contract so far everything i ve covered is the pmcc strategy as you would read or hear about it the following is my take and twist on it i am exclusively doing this with microsoft simply because it s microsoft as in it s a very reputable company and it only seems to go up if i have five call options i do not write five covered calls on it because i don t ever want to have to risk liquidating my entire options portfolio even if you make sure the risk is relatively low the risk is still there speaking of i buy the bulk of my options to be expiring one year or more from when i bought it so that it can qualify for longterm capital gains tax remember it s not just about how much money you make it s also about how much money you get to keep and what do i do with the options premiums i collect well i simply save until i get enough to buy another longterm in the money call option which lets me sell more cover call options which can then help me buy more call options which can then help me sell more covered call options you get the idea and lowers the cost basis of the call options i buy if i decide to continue injecting my own cash from my bank account also it gives me a bit of downside protection since i ll be able to keep the premium if things turn for the worst whereas normally if the option you buy doesn t end up working out you just lose everything and remember your longterm in the money call options will retain a good amount of their intrinsic value at least of course the whole idea is that the underlying asset will go up and at least move closer to your strike price overtime this is like buying a regular leap but with extra steps because along the way you have potential to make considerable income because of the premiums you collect if done correctly and all goes well you can exponentially grow your portfolio value really quickly with a lower risk than you would expect anyway this was a bit of a oversimplification i highly recommend you watch a youtube video if you are interested yes i am aware of the other greeks but i didn t want to bring them up because this post is already long and complicated as it is edit i replied to like 50 comments at this point what i m gonna do is just gather up the most commonly commented questions and then answer them in future post so please don t get offended if i don t respond to you here
chevron and gas prices chevron corporation a multinational energy corporation is one of the leading players in the oil and gas industry chevron is engaged in all aspects of the oil and gas industry including exploration production refining marketing and transportation as of 2021 chevron s market capitalization is approximately $200 billion chevron is listed on the new york stock exchange under the ticker symbol cvx chevron s stock has historically been a favorite among investors seeking stable and consistent dividend payments the company has a long history of paying dividends and has increased its dividend payout for 34 consecutive years chevron s dividend yield has typically been higher than the average dividend yield of the sp 500 index making it an attractive investment option for incomeoriented investors the price of chevron s stock is closely tied to global oil prices in 2020 the covid19 pandemic caused a drop in global oil demand which resulted in a decline in oil prices chevron s stock price was also affected by the decline in oil prices dropping to a low of $55 per share in march 2020 however as oil prices rebounded so did chevron s stock price as of march 2023 chevron s stock is trading at approximately $120 per share chevron is committed to investing in new technologies and renewable energy sources the company has set a goal to reduce its carbon emissions by 35 by 2028 and has invested in wind and solar energy projects while chevron s core business remains focused on oil and gas the company s investments in renewable energy demonstrate its commitment to transitioning to a lowcarbon economy overall chevron s stock is considered a relatively safe investment option for incomeoriented investors however like any investment it is important to conduct thorough research and consult with a financial advisor before making any investment decisions the company s dividend payout history commitment to innovation and position as a leader in the oil and gas industry are all factors that should be considered when evaluating chevron s stock the outcome of gas prices going down can have mixed impacts on the stock market on the positive side lower gas prices can benefit industries that rely on transportation such as airlines shipping companies and consumer goods companies these industries may see a reduction in their costs which could boost their profitability and stock prices additionally lower gas prices can benefit consumers who may see an increase in disposable income which could lead to higher spending and improved performance for consumerfocused stocks however lower gas prices can also have negative consequences for companies in the oil and gas sector lower gas prices may lead to reduced revenue and profitability for companies that are involved in exploration production and refining of oil and gas this could result in a decline in their stock prices and a reduction in investment in the sector furthermore lower gas prices can have an impact on the overall economy which can in turn affect the stock market if lower gas prices lead to increased economic growth and consumer spending this could be positive for the stock market however if lower gas prices lead to a slowdown in investment in the energy sector and a decline in economic activity this could have negative consequences for the stock market overall the outcome of gas prices going down on the stock market can depend on several factors including the overall state of the economy the performance of specific industries and the impact on consumer behavior investors should carefully monitor the effects of gas prices on the stock market and adjust their investment strategies accordingly

i ve seen some dog water technical analysis on gamestop s stock so here s my technical analysis and an analysis of uroutinehuckleberry5 s fud and bs firstly here s why uroutinehuckleberry5 s 921 ema is pure bs in his chart uroutinehuckleberry5 shows a basic strategy that every courseselling technical analysis guru uses the most wellknown and useless strategy out there a macd crossover this strategy is dog water for two reasons a macd crossover is a lagging strategy used mainly to determine trends in combination with other indicators instead of having any real predictive value on its own to explain it simply a macd crossover just shows that returns for a shorterterm period have been higher than returns for a longerterm period if anything such an indicator is actually a bad sign from a mean reversion perspective of ta as it could indicate the shortterm profits might be overextended he explained that the two profitable trades shown in the chart are proof that the strategy works and responded to a redditor who called out his bs by saying the following uhmm it crossed down in december as the chart shows and look at the effect it had went from $182 down to $83 to test his amazing strategy of buying on the crossover and selling on the crossunder i spent around 2 minutes to run a simple tradingview backtest backtest results for uroutinehuckleberry5 s strategy the backtest quickly showed that if you followed this 921 ema strategy since the ipo of gme only 26 of your trades would be profitable and ignoring the two successful trades that uroutinehuckleberry5 was using to claim the strategy worked you would have lost over 81 following this strategy since ipo jim cramer level losses now the two trades that he did show in the graph were phenomenal bringing the backtest back up to profitability but they re clearly not representative of the larger sample as shown by the enormous drawdown of 9252 and the terrible profitability of the strategy of course the backtest s results are this bad even while using the incorrect assumption that shorting can be done with 0 interest payments chart 1 backtest results for uroutinehuckleberry5 s mindblowing strategy with that out of the way let us move on to some technical analysis chart 2 weekly candlestick of $gme one glance at $gme s charts should tell anyone that this stock is a bull without a head and can run in a random direction very quickly with this in mind nobody can predict this stock with any degree of certainty unless they are manipulating the price starting with the ta concepts of trends support and resistance it should be clear to anyone that has studied technical analysis that chart 2 shows that $gme is running into an area of resistance around roughly 148 to 151 which was confirmed 3 times by pivot highs and one time with a bearish engulfing gme is also trading below the moving average for the past 300 days both of these are signs it s better to be shorting the stock than to be in the stock right now of course in theory both of these signs can be reversed and broken which is why i added extra indicators to check chart 3 daily candlestick chart of $gme with ma 300 ndo 14 and sqzmom indicators as well as support and resistance levels drawn the two indicators called ndo normal distribution outliers calculate a zscore for volume which helps determine if the volume is statistically significant for a day in this case both the ndo 14 with normal volume and the ndo 14 with short volume for the past week have been fairly insignificant falling within less than 1 times the 14day standard deviation of their average this takes the short squeeze argument away from shills as the short volume is nothing special now and so a short squeeze can t happen it also shows that the recent 1 week s rally doesn t have much strength behind it as few shares traded hands on the other hand using lazybear s squeeze momentum indicator which is pretty good at spotting reversals and momentum in the short term the indicator has turned to green which is generally a good sign for a stock showing some squeeze potential however the size of the green candle is so minor i don t believe that gme will be able to break resistance at the level around 148 to 153 so overall technical analysis of $gme reveals that the stock will most likely not go far above 153 in the short term of course if a whale suddenly jumps in and buys 5 minionillion shares then the price will rise but in my opinion this is less likely than the possibility of $gme s stock going down in value in the short run ps if anything do not buy options right now if you don t know the basics of option greeks according to ivolatilitycom the current implied volatility is around 13122 whereas the 30 historical volatility is 8645 a difference of 4477 percentage points this means u will get fucked by theta for buying options edit apparently cramer was bearish on gme therefore all my calculations r wrong and its hella competitive advantages one of the most profound concepts fostered by amazon is the idea of a virtuous cycle focused on the customer at amazon every move begins and ends with the customer in mind the result is exceptional customer experience which leads to more traffic and product reviews attracting more sellers thus contributing to a greater selection across all product categories the result improved customer experience which kicks off the virtuous cycle all over again the virtuous cycle inherently explains the impact of a network effect by uniquely focusing mainly on the customer sellers experience more interest and sales in their products as customers return to amazoncom for their shopping as the customer base grows so do sellers and their product selection and vice versa aws is the most widely known and used cloud platform in the world and amazon s advertising segment is gaining ground at a rapid pace aws and both sponsored and nonsponsored advertising benefit from network effects the former benefits from a vast user base of some of the largest enterprises in the world increasing the likelihood that other organizations searching for a cloud platform will choose aws additionally aws improves as more users initiate usage of the platform collecting data from many customers to create a more effective suite of cloud services and innovate in and around the aws ecosystem to provide an evergrowing number of services to meet organizational needs currently aws offers over 200 fully featured services across the ecosystem the most depth and breadth of services out of any of the major three cloud providers ie aws azure gcp the latter benefits from network effects in two distinct ways companies using sponsored advertising benefit from the large and growing amazon customer base to drive sales and those on nonsponsored advertising solutions benefit from a combination of datadriven programmatic advertising and popular amazon media platforms which are flush with users stemming from the aforementioned network effects are cost advantages high barriers to entry and the benefit of a global and highly reputable brand name in other words these moat characteristics are all interconnected amazon wins because it can offer products at a lower price than almost any company in the world which gives it its scale a deterrent of competition in and of itself according to evercore over 80 of amazon customers in their survey are either very satisfied or extremely satisfied with amazon alluding to the fact that the company puts the customer first this is an unattainable feat for virtually any company in the universe we believe these factors contribute to the reputable brand name of amazon which in turn helps drive adoption of other services like aws and advertising although it may seem that products and services sold on amazoncom have low switching costs given the plethora of other ecommerce websites and streaming services available to consumers we believe consumers face high switching costs when considering the power of the selectionpriceconvenience trifecta for the roughly 200 million prime customers around the world there is virtually no viable alternative that offers the variety of products for the low prices and free express shipping on millions of items at a cost of around $100 per year prime customers break even rather quickly considering the amount of shopping they do on the platform according to evercore research prime customers spend 2 3 times more money per month and shop twice as frequently as nonprime customers additionally more than 75 of prime customers purchase products 2 3 times per month on amazon we believe this consumer behavior and the extremely attractive price point of a prime membership for the value it offers ie free oneday and twoday shipping prime video unlimited music streaming and amazon prime reading brings to light the strength of the trifecta and how unattractive singlestore directtoconsumer alternatives appear to be in comparison regarding price selection and convenience why shop anywhere else when you ve got amazon carrying most if not all of your favorite products aws and amazon advertising should not be left out of the switching costs conversation aws customers may be reluctant to leave due to tangible and intangible costs as they relate to the following decision factors 1 aws provides the most services out of any cloud provider making it rather unlikely that there is much benefit in a customer switching cloud providers 2 cloud functionality may be similar but not quite the same between providers it may cost lots of time and money to recalibrate processes databases and functionalities between cloud providers 3 cloud operations are massive it is unlikely internal organizational teams will be able to learn another cloud platform and its uses quickly enough to avoid business and operational interruptions amazon advertising customers looking to leave the platform would also face enormous direct and indirect costs for one sponsored ads are hosted on the largest ecommerce website on the planet what better place to advertise your product than a website where hundreds of millions of visitors are already shopping for products further amazon s nonsponsored advertising and demandside platform dsp programmatic advertising could provide a more compelling offering than other dsps such as the trade desk given amazon s reach across proprietary sites and apps on top of thirdparty exchanges where many dsps solely operate advertisers on amazon leverage the generation moonshot why young investors are not ready to give up on risk financial times even amid a meltdown in crypt0 markets diy traders who came of age after the financial crisis no longer want to play by the old rules x200b with $1 000 in savings and two us government stimulus checks chris zettler began investing in 2020 first he bought companies he knew he says but then i got bored with it he moved on to call options in companies with volatile shareprices riding the price swings he used a win to buy 100 shares in the meme stock amc at $30 in may and sold at about $65 in june x200b the 35yearold finance major at the university of alabama birmingham had a td ameritrade account that allowed him to trade on margin borrowing money from the brokerage to amplify potential returns and place nearly $8 000 in bets with his original $4 000 of capital he turned that into $18 000 x200b zettler saw his account balance rise to $50 000 before falling to $35 000 when a bet went sideways he sold $20 000 of shares and paid his college tuition fees i got lucky as heck zettler says x200b yet the risk was worth it he adds the possibility of making outsized returns outweighed the risk of loss if i did it again would i have done it the responsible way and just sat on that $4 000 shoot noyou don t have anything to lose so you might as well shoot your shot x200b zettler is part of a generation of investors who came of age around the 2008 financial crisis and in its aftermath having struggled to accumulate wealth through traditional means over the past decade many have turned to speculating in the riskier corners of financial markets x200b experts say the growing appetite for speculative assets such as crypt0currencies nfts and meme stocks whose value skyrocketed in early 2021 driven by retail traders and social media hype is about more than just getting rich quick x200b stagnant wages rock bottom interest rates soaring house prices and now corrosive inflation have cut away at the idea that the under40s can follow the welltrodden path to financial security that their parents took younger investors report feeling like the game is rigged and that playing by the old rules is a losing strategy x200b in recent months a combination of inflation and rising interest rates have shaken the crypt0 markets crashing coin prices and the highprofile bankruptcies of crypt0 lenders and hedge funds have exposed the dangerous practices that flourished in the riskiest areas of the market the question now is whether the younger diy investors will retreat x200b zettler s experience suggests not he has watched his peers chase desperate bets on crypt0currencies and volatile stocks hoping to ride the next wave to riches a lot of people view it like they can t afford not to he says i think they re running out of hope x200b fear uncertainty and doubt natasha schll a cultural anthropologist at new york university blames the increased appetite for risk on a widespread disillusionment with the notion that economic success is accessible to anyone who works hard enough part of the appeal of crypt0currencies and memestock runs is that they are antiestablishment designed to operate outside the rules of the traditional financial system x200b the idea that the mainstream economy is trustworthy more so than these other assets is kind of dubious in recent experience she says there has been more and more willingness to say fuck it x200b the appetite for highrisk speculation is particularly sharp among americans who tend to have high levels of personal debt researchers say the average us student now graduates with $37 000 in student debt up from $17 000 in 2001 x200b the idea is that you re supposed to be able to save money for college but almost no middleclass family can in a significant way says caitlin zaloom a professor of social and cultural analysis at nyu there isn t enough financial stability at the core of people s lives if there was there would be little incentive to speculate x200b rent rises have outpaced income growth in most us states since 2001 according to estimates by the center on budget and policy priorities and inflation has pushed the cost of living higher in recent months as low interest rates and heavy debt became a fact of life relationships with risk changed experts say young investors are less likely to approach speculative financial products as investments with underlying value rather they are inclined to treat them like lottery tickets probably worthless but still worth the gamble on a lifechanging payout x200b if you had lottery tickets for houses investors would buy some of those too says jeremy grantham cofounder of the bostonbased asset management group gmo there is enormous inequality and when people get fed upthey start to behave in strange and new ways x200b the logic is simple says ben johnson head of exchange traded fund research at data provider morningstar negative real yields no thank you what are the alternatives jpegs of monkeys and fake internet money it s not surprising that investors feel like they re stuck between nft pet rocksopens a new window and a hard place x200b the discontent isn t limited to the us a majority of british 35yearolds surveyed by the insurance company urban jungle reported feeling at an unfair disadvantage to the generations directly before them when it comes to financial stability and savings x200b gary stevenson a 35yearold former trader and financial education campaigner from east london is one my dad never went to university he worked at the post office for 35 years and could raise three kids and pay off a mortgagehe has a comfortable retirement he says that is off the table for most young people now it s created a bit of a panic x200b if you can t do what your dad or grandad didyou have to come up with a better plan he adds at some point risky bets starts to look like the rational choice one way you see a zero per cent chance of success but if you take on insane riskat least you have a chance x200b to the moon during the meme stock frenzy of early 2021 stories of huge returns fuelled a rush of new trading some people won big an investor who bought gamestop in late december 2020 could have turned 10 000 into 168 744 in a single month when the meme stock hit its peak on january 29 2021 an almost 1 600 per cent gain but there was also the potential for huge losses an investor who bought at the top and then sold in late february would have shrunk the same 10 000 into 3 129 in a month following a 69 per cent plunge according to boring money analysis x200b even so many young investors reject the dumb money label applied to their trades they say the odds are worth the punt given the alternatives many investors remember the unequal recovery from the 2008 crisis when government bailouts followed by a decadelong bull run in markets left the uninvested behind when markets tumbled as covid19 hit in march 2020 they didn t want to miss out a second time new technology meant there was never an easier time to get involved x200b the introduction of commissionfree trading in stocks in the runup to the pandemic added momentum to lotterylike investing behaviour in 2015 the zerocommission brokerage robinhood was launched promising to democratise financial markets four years later almost every usbased broker had eliminated commissions for equity trading robinhood s gamelike app allowed customers to sign up and start trading stocks on their phones within minutes x200b slick crypt0currency exchanges such as coinbase emerged as the number of digital coins on the market exploded a meme coin craze driven by superinfluencers such as elon musk introduced an avalanche of outlandish offerings from those named after celebrities coinye west to the dog coins shiba inu and dog3coin in april 2013 there were just seven crypt0currencies available for mining and trading today there are tens of thousands x200b getting involved was simple it s five buttons on the website says luke hawley a 21yearold going into his senior year at endicott college in massachusetts who studies finance it s easier to buy shiba inu on coinbase than buy an index x200b hawley says it has become normal on his college campus to talk about betting and speculating people think ok i ve got a couple thousand in the bank in the real world that s like broke he says there s a lot of fomo he adds about the idea of passing over a chance to turn a small stake into big money x200b young men in particular have been attracted to this kind of moonshot investing the vast majority of crypt0currency investors are men and more than 90 per cent of trades in gamestop and amc were made by men during the peak of the meme stock frenzy according to the uk brokerage interactive investor experts say one reason these investments are treated like casual bets is because the brokerage apps feel like gambling platforms only without the regulatory guardrails x200b increasingly platforms are blurring the line between gaming gambling and investing especially platforms that enable the use of crypt0currency says jack symons chief executive of the uk app gamban which allows users to block gambling apps on their phones and computers gamban began to block brokerage and crypt0 platforms last summer some might say this is a blunt approach but gambling doesn t look like it used to it s not something that only happens in a casino on green felt symons said in october x200b late last year the largest american gambling hotline told the financial times it was seeing a marked increase in the number of calls coming from people addicted to day trading rather than traditional gambling or sports betting one reason might be that as stevenson explains investing does not carry the same social stigma as gambling x200b if you said my dad spends all day gambling i d say oh man i m so sorry for your family he says but if someone says my dad spends all day fx trading you think he s the wolf of wall streetit s not gambling it s investing and investing is how you get rich x200b diamond hands in recent months as the air has rushed out of the crypt0currency balloon the most speculative parts of the market have been hardest hit but as prices crashed attempts by some crypt0 companies to persuade investors to keep faith and hold on through what they dismissed as just another cyclical crypt0 winter shows the growing power of online communities x200b the under25s are twice as likely to turn to social media for financial advice than any other age group and more than three times as likely to do so than to seek help from a professional according to a survey by uk advisory openmoney x200b robinhood s rise happened as online communities on twitter and reddit began to play a bigger role in investing reddit subforums such as rwallstreetbets provided specialist information for wouldbe investors facilitated their discussions and plucked at their heartstrings x200b big losses could be laughed off with peers and big gains shared and celebrated those who held their nerve were lauded for their hubris diamond hands became the emojivernacular for holding tight to a bold position even when it collapses x200b a study by academics at the university of sydney last year found that people aged between 18 and 24 were much more likely to make risky decisions when they thought their peers were watching agnieszka tymua the lead researcher on the study says online communities of investors amplify the same behaviour people want to take risks to get that big win and post about it x200b the illusion of control also amplifies risk taking whether by laying out the specifics of niche crypt0currencies or discussing moonshot strategies web forums encourage members to feel that the odds of winning are significantly greater than they actually are regulation has not kept up with the spread of misinformation x200b some college students say they are increasingly familiar with the dangers of crypt0currency pump and dump schemes such as socalled rugpulls when a developer launches a crypt0asset drives the price up via social media influencers and then disappears with their gains before the price collapses x200b it s not pretty being on the back end of a rugpull says harrison turner a 19yearold rising college junior from montgomery alabama still he says he understands the influencer s motivation he saw an opportunity and he took it x200b get rich slow despite the increasingly hostile investing environment highrisk speculation may be here to stay it worked spectacularly well for some people and old habits die hard says steve sosnick chief strategist at us trading platform interactive brokers they re still using margin to speculate even as rates go up x200b in may the amount of money borrowed to trade on margin was 25 per cent above prepandemic levels data from finra shows x200b traditional wealth managers are uneasy about the prospect of digital assets going mainstream nearly half of fund selectors say they feel pressure to offer crypt0currencies to attract younger investors according to research by natixis yet 70 per cent say they think individuals should not have exposure to the volatile asset x200b crypt0currency is not the systemic solution to income inequality says georgia lee hussey a wealth manager and founder of modernist financial if your investing strategy is sexy you re doing it wrong x200b brokerages are also worried that investors burnt by big losses could retreat from markets entirely reinforced in their view that the game is rigged attempts to educate potential clients means reaching investors where they are on social platforms fidelity has embraced both digital assets and social media outreach in an effort to connect with investors and convince them it is possible to get rich slow x200b young investors report that their top concern is their financial security how to have enough to be ok says kelly lannan head of emerging customers at fidelity it s very basicwe hear that more with this generation x200b while zettler says he has become more boring with his investments others like turner are still comfortable risking it all he has already lost his brokerage funds once by mistiming a memestock bet but says he can always earn enough to put a few thousand dollars in a brokerage account the money will come and go he says he knows he could lose it all x200b then again he says he could get lucky number 1 tip of trading stocks options do not use margin throughout the years of surfing wallstreetbets some of the worst loss porn i ve ever seen has to be people on margin accounts basically where traders get at least 2x of the money they deposited loaned to them which theoretically can work out if your correct but more often than not if a trade goes against you more so in options then you end up owing the brokerage money on top of the money you already lost from your initial deposit also known as a deficit but i do have a few tips so you don t screw yourself over if you can t or don t want to switch from a margin account then have some selfdiscipline by only using the balance you deposited made money on if your using robinhood then you can disable margin account menu investing disable margin investing note by disabling margin you still have access to features such as instant bank deposits instant settlement if on any other brokerage then i recommend switching to a cash account personally i ve been trading the markets for 5 years and never once ran into this issue because very early on i was taught to only risk money i can afford to lose

the only true dd here avoid all the noises i was predicting this move today because margin calls already flushed out the sellers from friday s selloff t3 so i fully expected buyers to step in today and it does not come as a surprise to me but here is the dd on the loans and potential bankruptcy if you re interested in reading something from someone like me who has 15 years of active investing anyone who watched how sears went down should already know that drawing down on revolver or emergency loan does not help them avoid bankruptcy don t get me wrong $bbby will most definitely operate the stores until after the holidays but when their cash runs dry they could file for chapter 11 even before the holidays knowledgeable investors are already expecting this types of loans to happen so even though it may come as a bullish surprise for some meme stock investors it is not a surprise for experienced investors despite all the noises you hear on these message boards before a company goes into bankruptcy lenders will always try to benefit from the downfall including issuing loans backed by merchandise and other assets while earning very high fees and interest at little risk to them remember how sears chairman eddie lampert made himself the largest creditor and sears owed him at least $13 billion in loans backed by the company s assets before it filed for chapter 11 also anyone who is hoping for someone to buy the buybuy baby business does not understand what lenders actually think if they can buy some of those assets as part a bankruptcy auction at a much lower price why buy now with the amount of debt they owe it is a hot mess nobody wants to touch right now also as you can see they were unable to issue more shares during the meme stock frenzy which means the board is crippled a crippled board will not be able to package the deal for buybuy baby stores well enough for any potential interested buyers to step in you may hear lots of noises before bankruptcy like certain investors wanting to step in and buy some assets from the company but history of most companies that eventually went into bankruptcy tells us it will not happen until way after they file for chapter 11 most likely months after that a bankruptcy judge will have to approve on the deal conclusion an emergency loan only helps the lenders make money but will not help $bbby avoid bankruptcy and will not help with any shareholder value if anything it only makes the shareholder value smaller in bankruptcy court after all the remaining assets are transferred to the lenders how to benefit from this situation if you want to make certain money and avoid all the noises you hear on message boards just go buy 2023 puts and forget about it and come back in 2023 some facts about sears sears actually got a 350mil emergency loan a month after they filed for chapter 11 on oct 15 2018 to allow the stores to operate through the holidays sears arranges emergency financing 5 days before filing for chapter 11

why every valuation method is wrong hi everyone so this is probably the wrong place to post this but maybe someone can help me i have never made a post here before but i have recently been thinking about the weighted average costs of capital wacc that wall street uses i have concluded that dcf ddm and ri valuation models do not work however this is not because people can not perfectly predict the future and each of these models can vary a lot based on their assumptions about the future but that is not why i think these methods are broken for starters every major firm on wall street uses the capm when determining the cost of equity for a company the company s market cap weights the cost of equity and the cost of debt to form the wacc so i see two main issues here first the cost of debt is straightforward but the cost of equity relies on a very outdated model not to mention the fact that the market cap is derived from the stock price and shares outstanding if we can all assume for a moment that i am right about the cost of equity analysts use being completely wrong then every stock would be mispriced and if every stock is mispriced the wacc that every analyst hypothesizes would be wrong even if an analyst could perfectly estimate future cash flows they would not be able to properly value securities because they would be using an incorrect wacc from capm cost of equity to discount them back to present value and this would mean that the use of the market cap to weight equity and debt would be fundamentally flawed i just remembered when i first took an investment in equities course in college i learned about better alternatives to the capm everyone here has probably heard of the arbitrage pricing theory apt and the fama and french 3 and 5factor models but why does no one use these models i have not been able to get this off my mind lately this is just one example and i am sure there are newer and even better factor models to determine the cost of equity i have done many 3statementmodels with dcf ddm and ri valuations and i am just not realizing how little that matters if everyone is using the capm which only takes a beta with respect to the excess return of the overall market then every assumption is fundamentally wrong wouldn t a multifactor model with statistically significant betas for securities be much more accurate hopefully someone understands what i am trying to say and can help explain i have not slept in a while sorry if this did not make much sense i would be happy to explain further if anyone wants me to x200b ape translation analysts are dumb and wrong most of the time because there are much more accurate models to value stocks also even those models are still shit so we re all better off using good old evrev evebitda pe and pfcf multiples to value stocks
thoughts on trading premiums prior to earnings regards i ve been stewing on this sub for a while bought my first calls on bumble last week to watch them go to zero bought on morning of earnings and watched the premium climb 20 by the time market closed got me thinking can i buy options the morning of or day before earnings and sell before market close just scalping the increase in iv as earnings approach thinking the strategy would be as follows 1 buy weekly otm callsputs close to earnings only strikes with large open interest 2 sell before close as iv rises 3 if premium hasn t risen either ride the gamble through earnings or cut losses on the premium depending on conviction assuming the stock won t move too much in either direction on the day of earnings does the stock have to move in my direction for my premium value to increase even if its otm will iv always increase as earnings approach has anyone succeeded with this or a similar strategy any feedback appreciated

moody s fraud per bard yes moody s investors service a credit rating agency has been accused of fraud and manipulation of the stock market in the past the most significant instance was in the leadup to the 2008 financial crisis when moody s was accused of inflating the ratings of residential mortgagebacked securities rmbs and collateralized debt obligations cdos these securities were often based on subprime mortgages which were mortgages given to borrowers with poor credit histories as the housing market began to decline in 2007 many of these subprime mortgages defaulted causing the value of rmbs and cdos to plummet this led to widespread losses for investors and contributed to the financial crisis in 2017 moody s agreed to pay $864 million to settle allegations that it had misled investors about the creditworthiness of rmbs and cdos the settlement included a $4375 million payment to the justice department and $4263 million to be divided among 21 states and the district of columbia moody s has also been accused of fraud in other cases in 2013 the securities and exchange commission sec charged moody s with failing to disclose its ties to the investment banks that issued the securities it rated the sec also accused moody s of failing to adequately review the creditworthiness of the securities moody s agreed to pay a $28 million penalty to settle the sec charges these are just two examples of the allegations of fraud and manipulation that have been made against moody s the company has faced numerous lawsuits and regulatory investigations and it has paid billions of dollars in settlements these allegations have raised serious questions about the integrity of moody s credit ratings and the role of credit rating agencies in the financial system

spy falling into the new year spy falling into the new year introduction spy is poised to retest $34811 the current 52 week low i will debrief for you regards the current market conditions catalysts spy s current market structure and my technical analysis lastly i will provide my positions market conditions federal funds rate projections based on these projections from the latest fomc meeting the fed is not going to cut rates until 2024 yield curve inversion shortterm interest rates are higher than longterm rates hot cpi increased cost of living means less cash inflows for corporations as there will be a reduction in personal savings rate no stimulated spending like in 2020 s market catalysts rising interest rates causes equity valuations to fall across all sectors cost of debt and cost of equity will increase for companies inverted yield curve will cause banks greater operating costs this is a riskoff market banks operate by borrowing at a shortterm rate and lending money to consumers at a longterm rate paired with the rising rate to borrow money overnight from the rising federal fund rate banks are conservative with their investments in these conditions spy market structure this is weekly aggregated candles for spy the blue ellipses mark swing highs and the orange ellipses mark swing lows spy is making lower swing highs and lower swing lows this is a clear downtrend spy technical analysis this is weekly aggregated candles for spy yellow trendline marks the lows of the candles in the most recent leg up and we see the last two weeks breaking this trendline and starting the next leg down macd is a modified version that reacts faster to price changes we see the fast line cyan curling downward which supports our thesis the longer average line yellow is sloping downwards and is below 0 the cyan $410 priceline marks the previous swing high this week we broke out above it but immediately fell back down this is a false breakout and many bulls around 40 and there were ppl panic selling like crazy every newspaper every news channel was talking about the subprime mortgage collapse and there was a lot of uncertainty on the street i knew this guy from college and later found out he was one of our clients he calls me and ask of what is happening he was an engineer with a car manufacturer who had just lost his job and his wife was a homemaker i told him about the situation and told him not to panic he had been a good saver over the years and had put together a nice nest egg which on an average day was worth around 800k but bc of the situation it was around 430k his money was in couple different funds i told him to only withdraw what he needs to survive the next 6 months as his house was already payed off i said get any job even a minimum wage job just keep money coming in keep applying to jobs where you can use your degree engineering gig but whatever you do do not sell anything more than what he needs for a few months me and him got into an argument about not selling i told him that even if it all goes to 200k tommorow is another day and that he should have confidence in american businesses over a long period of time i told him that bear market over corrects in situations like this and not only he should not be selling if anything he should be buying more bc the valuations were crazy cheap he said it was ppl like me that was the problem he called me a wall street scumbag not surprisingly he did not take my advise and sold everything i saw him today and he was the one that brought up the call and he barreling towards bankruptcy only through the magic of massive dilution second bad point eos raised that money from some of the absolute worst sources of capital available to shitty public companies an alternative lender read loan shark named yorkville advisors yorkville finances eos through a secondary equity purchase agreement sepa which allows eos to raise debt at will from yorkville the problem is that yorkville can at any time call that note and force eos to issue shares to yorkville to pay off the note at a discount to the lowest daily average over the past 5 or so days yorkville then dumps the shares on the public market causing intraday swings of 10 or more i suspect yorkville is actually shorting the shares in advance of acquiring the shares using the worst trading methods possible to depress the share price as much as quickly as possible then covering using the sepa yorkville gets all of its shares under the sepa at the lowest intraday average price so the bigger the delta between when it starts selling and the lowest price the more yorkville makes this is the biggest risk in the near term for eos that it will need to raise more capital tanking the stock leaving us as bag holders but we have help on the way enter jigar shah the head of the department of energy loan program office who is making it rain on green tech companies to the tune of $400 billion heres the good news its going to get a huge cheap department of energy title 17 loan the department of energy s loan program office is about to swoop in and provide a minimum of $250 million dollars of financing which is an immediate catalyst to sending eos to the fuckin moon eos has been pursuing this loan for over a year and everything points to an imminent approval of the loan for the following reasons 1 eos is the only major player in the nonlithium ion gridscale battery pack a major focus of influential senators including none other than joe manchin the chairman of the senate energy and natural resources committee 2 eos sources over 90 of its materials for its batteries from the united states this also helps it qualify for additional tax credits under the ira which we ll talk about below 3 eos estimates that the loan will help it generate 700 new jobs in a key battleground state for the upcoming elections pennsylvania where its main manufacturing facility is located 4 at an investor conference on jun 9 2023 the ceo said this about how the loan is progressing eos is in the final innings with the process and has solidified most of the commercial terms the company s attorneys are working through the final punch list of items after which it will be submitted for treasury final review that review process should be completed within 30 days of submission and if approved will be followed by an official announcement oh and by the way jigarshah tweeted in a subsequently deleted tweet on april 1 that many announcements are coming to pittsburgh and the ohio river valley if eos gets the loan this would completely remove bankruptcy risk priced at 10year treasury plus a slight risk premium making the company fully investable for investment funds looking for exposure to the only us based non lithium storage company delivering commercially deployed batteries eos is a huge beneficiary of the inflation reduction act eos gets incredible benefits from the inflation reduction act hitting all sides of the income statement energy storage installations are eligible for the following ira benefits of which eos can qualify for every single one 1 a 30 investment tax credit to the buyer for installation of energy storage 2 a 10 tax credit to the buyer for domestic content 3 a 10 tax credit for installation of the storage in an energy transition zone 4 eos gets a $35kwh production tax credit for cell manufacturing 5 eos also gets a $10kwh production tax credit for domestic battery module assembly 6 finally a 10 qualifying tax credit for active electrode material costs there is near infinite demand for energy storage as of dec 2022 eos had an order backlog for committed orders of $535m a lot of orders were sitting on the side lines waiting for guidance on domestic content for the 10 additional tax credit mentioned above and the company is currently projecting for $1b of new booked orders for 2023 this translates to roughly 6 gwh of backlog on a longer timescale the company had another $15 billion of lois another $7 billion of active proposals and $10 billion of lead generation available to be converted to loans look for another ldes provider at scale there aren t any the only competitors are tesla and fluence that sell lithium ion grid batteries at about twice the cost of eos eos battery economics are turning a corner in q1 eos produced the last of its handmade second generation battery q2 will be dedicated to transitioning to a semi automated production line that will significantly improve economics and scale and q3q4 will be all about the ramp eos touts the following improvements between z2 and z3 batteries 1 15 immediate improvement in cost structure with another 1535 gained by deploying automation that has already been ordered 2 cycle times for production vastly decreased resulting in 9x battery output 3 q1 2022 to q1 2023 has already seen a 24 decrease in cogs during which time revenue increased by 168 on an absolute basis not per unit the company has already put down payments on long lead time items critical to manufacturing the z3 batteries eos doesn t talk about its ultimate target cost per kwh but its main competitor redflow a tiny even earlier stage zinc based battery company based out of australia that doesn t get the benefit of the inflation reduction act hopes to achieve a $100 per kwh cogs eos has significant baked in value eos is projecting for approximately 6 gwh of backlog at the end of 2023 which results in $270 million of production tax credits which will be paid to the company on top of that eos being a shitty spac has significant net operating loss carry forwards which can be used to offset future net income similar to all the people who post loss porn on wsb but pricebushel 35 x200b my philosophy this all really isn t that complicated us humans aren t much smarter than chimps and so anything we create won t be complex it s in the interpretation of these very simple core systems that we project a bunch of meaningless abstractions on top financial markets are not moral they don t exist to punish the wicked and reward the righteous when the doomsayers come out to tell us we re about to suffer for our sins they misunderstand what game we re playing financial markets are not that important interest rates quantitative easing stimulus deficits reserve currencies etc are all things we made up to control the flow of madeup stores of value through a financial lattice that we made up they re far more reactive to realworld events than drivers of realworld events we ve had tech bubbles at high rates in the 902000s we ve had them at low rates the whole spectrum from booms to busts can happen in a diverse multitude of fiscal environments developed nations will continue to surprise at how quickly they can overcome even the seemingly most dire financial crises because we made all of finance up it can only hurt you as much as you let it ie the great depression how to make money buy hypergrowth like $shop the stocks that were hit hardest on deep recession fears and rising rates will do the best when the opposite happens much like how quantitative easing direct financial stimulus closing manufacturing and lowering rates increased inflation and then when we did the opposite it decreased inflation shopify is a great business that i regsho bbby for those unaware rule 203b3 of regulation sho requires that participants of a registered clearing agency must immediately purchase shares to close out failures to deliver in securities with large and persistent failures to deliver referred to as threshold securities if the failures to deliver persist for 13 consecutive settlement days threshold securities are equity securities that have an aggregate fail to deliver position for five consecutive settlement days at a registered clearing agency eg national securities clearing corporation nscc totaling 10 000 shares or more and equal to at least 05 of the issuer s total shares outstanding as provided in rule 203 of regulation sho threshold securities are included on a list disseminated by a selfregulatory organization sro although as a result of compliance with rule 204 generally a participant s fail to deliver positions will not remain for 13 consecutive settlement days if for whatever reason a participant of a registered clearing agency has a fail to deliver position at a registered clearing agency in a threshold security for 13 consecutive settlement days the requirement to closeout such position under rule 203b3 remains in effect bbby added to the list the countdown begins options chain ftd gamma keep slamming those watermelons hard every friday that rolls over with calls in the money good at this rate our weeks are rolling over with 30 strike targets itm with 10 s of thousands of contracts in the money they all get stacked and need to be exercised 10 s of thousands of contracts x 100 shares per contract need to be exersised at each strike price this watermelon volcano is gonna cream all over our bank accounts in the next month hold and buy

half of ryan cohans shares and all of his call options are subject to 6 month shortswing rule the shortswing rule basically states that any profit from sales of securities that were purchased within 6 months would goto the company on ryan cohan s 13d form for bbby it shows the date of his purchases at the bottom as of today 4 100 000 shares are not subject to the 6 month shortswing rule the rest of his 3 680 000 shares as well as all of his call options are still subject to the shortswing profit rule all of his call options would come out of the 6th month period on sept 1st or 2nd basically he can t sell his options and almost half his stock unless he wants to donate that money to bbby would be crazy if he actually sold his calls during a major runup to donate the money to bbby and help out with debt but that is a little too retarded for me to think about much him being part of a pump and dump doesn t make much sense since he cant sell half of his shit and also that the price is barely above what he bought in for also considering he never sold a single stock of gme during any of its runs gives me some confidence that he isn t in it for the money

from forbidden forests to legal gardens harry potter s journey to declassify cannabis ithuf ianthus capital holdings inc description ianthus is a vertically integrated cannabis company with operations in the united states they focus on owning and managing licensed cannabis cultivation processing and dispensary facilities 1 thc delta9tetrahydrocannabinol description thc is one of the most abundant and wellknown cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant it s responsible for the psychoactive effects commonly associated with marijuana 2 cbd cannabidiol description cbd is another major cannabinoid but unlike thc it is nonpsychoactive it has gained popularity for its potential therapeutic benefits including pain relief reducing anxiety and promoting relaxation 3 cbg cannabigerol description cbg is often referred to as the mother cannabinoid because it is a precursor to other cannabinoids it has potential therapeutic properties including antiinflammatory and neuroprotective effects 4 cbn cannabinol description cbn is a mildly psychoactive cannabinoid that forms as thc ages or is exposed to oxygen it s believed to have sedative properties and may be helpful for sleeprelated issues 5 thcv tetrahydrocannabivarin description thcv is similar in structure to thc but produces different effects it s known for its potential to suppress appetite and may have therapeutic applications for metabolic disorders 6 cbdv cannabidivarin description cbdv is structurally similar to cbd but has different properties it shows promise in the treatment of epilepsy and other neurological disorders 7 cbc cannabichromene description cbc is one of the lesserknown cannabinoids it s nonpsychoactive and is being studied for its potential antiinflammatory and analgesic painrelieving properties 8 cbda cannabidiolic acid description cbda is the acidic precursor to cbd it is usually converted to cbd through decarboxylation heating it has shown potential in reducing inflammation 9 thca tetrahydrocannabinolic acid description thca is the acidic form of thc it is nonpsychoactive and must be decarboxylated heated to convert into thc it s abundant in raw unheated cannabis

compass minerals international inc $cmp charged for misleading investors time to short sec announced that compass cmp was ordered to pay $12 million to settle charges for misleading investors about a technology upgrade that the company claimed would reduce costs at its most significant mine but in reality had increased costs and for failing to properly assess whether to disclose the financial risks created by the company s excessive discharge of mercury in brazil according to the sec s order compass repeatedly assured investors in 2017 that a technology upgrade at its goderich mine the world s largest underground salt mine which is located near ontario canada and hailed by the company as its crown jewel was on track to materially reduce costs and boost its operating results starting in 2018 compass s statements were misleading because they failed to tell investors that costs at the mine were increasing rather than decreasing which substantially undermined the projected savings the sec also found that compass misled investors by overstating the amount of salt it was able to produce at goderich the sec s order found that compass violated the antifraud reporting and internal controls provisions of the securities act and the exchange act and various related rules current and previous investors can join a claim for a further class action a company trading at a roughly similar level as a month ago should we expect a market reaction to this

the bear case for northrop grumman $noc while northrop beat earnings expectations today their stock dropped but that is not the focus on hand you may have heard of viasat $vsat stock dropping 30 2 weeks ago because of their $700 million satellite failed to deploy its reflectors once in space the spacecraft is boeing which was successfully launched by space x s falcon heavy the part that failed is one of the most important the antenna and without it working it is ultimately a complete loss northrop grumman is the one responsible for the antenna as noted here in their data sheet flawless performance with 100 on orbit success right anyway viasat s satellite is insured up to $420 million but the way space insurance works is that not one company insures the entire piece what these space insurance companies do is put up a bid for covering parts of the satellite they will tell you under which conditions they will pay out how much they will pay for a loss and how much it will cost for the service it s a long complicated process which will have a major impact on the space industry once the claim is filed even if somehow viasat manages to be comped all $420 million they re still on the hook for the rest of the $280 million would they eat the cost no they re going to come after ng with a huge lawsuit that would range from $280m being the minimum to the entire cost of the satellite $700m x200b now you might be wondering why don t they just fix the satellite or send over a team to space at this point a manned mission to repair something floating in space will cost much more than to just sent an entirely new one up the ground team from ng can only do so much and it s not looking good far more likely for the satellite to end up being a piece of space junk from this article in a statement to channel futures viasat said we had an unexpected event during the deployment of one of the satellite s reflectors which may materially impact the viasat3 americas satellite our team is working very closely with our reflector manufacturer to take corrective action yet they are still in the early stages of working through the event and its root cause and expect to gather additional data in the coming weeks viasat said they would share more information during the company s earnings call next month since ng did not talk about this during their earnings call i m fully
